i5iSPi3CZUJFlocDJqpgGQ.text: I arrived about 6:50. Took about 10 minutes to get seated. Finally got seated, no one came around for a while. Finally got to order. Ordered an appetizer.. that did not arrive for over an hour. The food came shortly after that. The only redeeming quality about this place is that it wasn't cold when it arrived. Service was also terrible. When we asked the waiter about the appetizer that was taking forever, he gave us a sassy reply like he thought we thought he was making them himself. My food did not have any corned beef inside of it either. Big letdown Would not return

rk0_Gsc3TcCfqJTjqCTwXg.text: This place had some of the best pierogis & it really resembled a lot of the Pittsburgh culture!! If you're in town & looking for something different, this is the place to go!!

XqGtB8Ub88syUsEAmNfNIA.text: Was so excited to eat here, but will never go back. First it was freezing (they finally lite outdoor patio heaters). We wanted both pierogi's and sandwiches however we couldn't get sandwiches because they had no bread?! The bathroom looked like a crime scene, the handicap bathroom was taped off, the floors were filthy, no hand soap but a big open bottle of commercial handsoap was on the counter, no paper towels. The service was slow and not very friendly. The only positive was the food was amazing (over priced for the service and appearance)but good however had I went to the bathroom before we got our food we probably would have left. We ended with over hearing the staff complaining because the dishwasher was broken. Very disappointed because we have been looking forward to eating here but would not recommend.

ddMhIcg0STto1E8ATAeK3w.text: Literally the worst food experience I have ever had.  The restaurant was packed-- and everyone seemed to be having a good time, so my husband and I waited for a solid 35-40 minutes. A staff member stated we could sit downstairs-- said they were remodeling, but it was a space.  Little did we know that there was absolutely NO heat and they had space heaters (2) placed down there.  We reluctantly sat down, as we had waited so long and had an event starting decently soon.  Another couple was seated at the table next to us.  The waiter took both our drink orders then left.  Then he came back with the other table's drinks-- but not ours.  He then said he would have our drinks-- and then took down both our table and the other table's food orders.  He had a notepad and seemed to have been writing down our orders (not complicated-- no changes to the items).  10 minutes later he finally came back empty handed-- got to our table and was like YOUR DRINKS- then ran and got them.  Fast forward another forty minutes, the other table asked when the food would be coming.  He said it should be up now-- and went back and grabbed the food. Our food was apparently not ready-- I asked about when our food would be ready-- he said let me check on that for you.  Fast forward thirty more minutes (the other table had finished their food and cashed out), he came and said there was a problem and he never ordered our food-- but no worries, he had put it in now.  Frustrated and hungry, we said that's fine. Give us our check now and we will pay.  20 more minutes, our food came out.  My husband's meal was supposed to be a grilled chicken sandwich with all the fixings (lettuce, avocado, bacon, etc.)-- he literally got a piece of grilled chicken and one piece of bacon.  I got the perogis-- onions and butter and cheese.  My perogis were both severely undercooked or burnt depending on which side of the plate I was eating from.  They were basically inedible.  Our waiter came back with our check (he comped one beer due to the wait) and asked how the food was-- I stated that the food was inedible. He shrugged his shoulders.  Do not waste your time at this restaurant-- I am not one to complain about restaurants-- but I have never left a place so angry in my life.

wHRBybQNNfghbFLkYoLWqw.text: First off, the portions are unreal!! I had seen this place hyped up on Facebook and knew I wanted to try it. We visited late on a Friday evening after the dinner rush so we were seated promptly. The atmosphere is industrial and rustic with a full bar at the front. Our waitress, as well as all the staff we encountered, was extremely friendly and happy to give recommendations on what was popular. We ordered a couple drinks, our mules weren't that great- I think next time We would stick to beer. My boyfriend is a pierogi lover and couldn't decide. He went with the classic onion and I chose the Buffalo chicken... When our meals arrived we realized we could have split one entree. Again, the portions are unreal!!!! I'm not a huge lover of pierogis but I did enjoy these... Especially with the Buffalo chicken on top. We will be back as there are other interesting combinations we want to try, but next time we will definitely split.

I had a bad experience at the restaurant the service was extremely slow and when the food came out it was burnt on the outside and raw on the inside of course no one ever came by to check on us Of course I got sick in the bathroom the food was so bad I just wanted to get out. He continued to harass me on Facebook not only does this man serve bad food but  is a bully and tries to intimidate you via Facebook he has been sending me mean messages calling me all kinds of mean names

9_IwmGDj6c9GhEZxCEJrpg.text: Skip it. We had a party of 4 and were warned (rather stringently and multiple times) that it would be a LONG wait. That exaggeration was not wrong. We waited for at least 40 minutes on our food. The wait staff visited our table as little as possible and we sat with water glasses empty throughout the dinner. When our order finally came out, two of the orders were wrong and a side of fries were forgotten. The "Pittsburgh salad" was served without the Pierogis and the waitress acted like she had no idea there were supposed to be Pierogis on it. When asking about the side of fries, we were asked if we asked for them when we ordered... they never came and weren't on the check (so we know the order was never placed). The concept is good, but the food in general was bland. We had multiple types of Pierogis on the table and we all shared, but they were so under seasoned we were all disappointed. Parking is regular downtown Pittsburgh parking, either you pay to park in a garage, or you're lucky enough to find street parking within a few blocks of where you're going.

K4uQ-oMOACsZqIrBNbuBwQ.text: My husband and I visited the bar at Stuff'd during a buzzing weekend in the city; pride fest and the art walk. We live in Denver and this was my hubby's first visit to the city. We were bar hopping, trying small bites at local restaurants, and exploring the town when we came upon Stuff'd. We sat at the bar and has an AWESOME time with the help of a fantastic bartender named Nathan. HE made our experience there memorable and entertaining. That grapefruit vodka mixed drink---so perfect! Conversations with him, some of the other staff, and a nice couple from Texas really made this experience one worth sharing. When you have the right people representing your company, good things happen. Thanks Nathan!

SM-g1cpeXGevUhGTm1x4sQ.text: Pierogies were tasty, good service, and nice selection on tap.  This was our first trip and we definitely want to go back. I absolutely loved the halushki. Other reviews had us concerned but the food was prompt and everything was good.  The only thing I would change was the potato and cheese pierogies by having the cheese inside and melty instead of on top.

jU6fcX3x34psP-YQ5IwDmw.text: I came here with my aunt and ordered the black and blue burger which was good but the service was awful and I usually give everyone a few chances before I would write a review like this. My aunt and I were at our table and this customer approached us who was clearly intoxicated and stood in front of our table and kept talking to us which is fine I'm not going to be rude but then he asked me if he could give me a foot massage which is obviously creepy and I said no thanks and was hoping he would leave and he did but then he decided to come back and ask me if I wanted his male parts (in a more polite way than what was said) it took everything in me not to punch him in the face . I went and told the manager and she kicked him out after she told me that he was just standing around being weird prior to this but she thought he was harmless and she thought he had something wrong with him. There was nothing wrong with him except he was extremely intoxicated. The manager should of called the cops on him for harassment but she didn't. What upset me the most was the waitress were laughing about it and coming up to my table and asking about it they thought it was funny even the manager was joking about it. I just think it's extremely disrespectful and it was handled properly at all. I know that the staff cannot control other people's actions but they could have came over and apologized or asked if everything was ok but they didn't they thought it was a big joke. I'm paying 50 dollars for a meal to have some drunk guy harass me and management just use it to their entertainment. When I was a waitress I would of never went up to someone's table after they just had a bad experience and try to ask them about it. That is just extremely unprofessional. Also our waitress was so invested in talking about what happened then doing her job we had to ask her multiple times for sour cream and she kept forgetting our drinks. I will never come back here this was the second time and the food is sub par for the price and definitely not worth the unprofessional behavior.

BFYMgJsCgPW2h6gUV-YTjw.text: This was very sad.  The food was cold & undercooked.  They need Bar Rescue tocome in and give a wake up call.  The product is there but the service isn't.  Don't go. Save your money.

lHfMsXHMJ-0lRKZQgBGD0Q.text: The food at this place was hit-or-miss. I really enjoyed the pierogie plate I shared with a friend (fried mac & cheese), but didn't enjoy the ones I ordered on my own very much (pan fried spinach & cheese).   But honestly, the issue here is the service. It's horrendous. I went for lunch, and it really wasn't all that busy. The food took nearly an hour to arrive. The server was not super friendly, but somehow also seemed slammed... yet there were very few tables.  This was our second try. The first time we came at dinner time, and we waited in line for a while only to be shown to a downstairs area that was still under construction. We decided to leave.  Considering this place has been open for several months, it seems like they should have it together by now.  Based on the food, I would give this place another shot... but the service is so bad that it's quite unlikely.   If you decide to go, just know you'll wait ages for your food and the customer service will leave much to be desired...

Ue4o2sLjaNEfR07s110lQQ.text: Nope. Not into it. Sorry to disappoint yinz but the excitement of having a restaurant dedicated to the beloved pierogi is pretty short lived once you go and actually eat said pierogies. I met my boyfriend there one night and he ordered the chicken parm pierogies and I ordered the cheeseburger. I don't  have too many issues with my order. It was what I anticipated but was pretty mediocre. The chicken parm pierogies my boyfriend got were pretty sad looking though. They looked as if they sat out and the cheese had hardened on top. They were also pierogies stuffed with chicken and then covered in chicken, sauce and cheese...For once in my life, there was just too much meat.Chicken on chicken and it wasn't very appetizing.   A couple of side notes that probably make me sound like a jerk. The waitress forgot about us a couple of times and even told us. It was pretty dead in there and I have to admit when I was 18 and a waitress, the slow times were definitely my weakest times. So I get it but she probably shouldn't have continued to tell us how she forgot we existed.

v1QwUmPenSksrtLveF9lkA.text: The food was phenomenal and the staff was super friendly and helpful. I ordered the mac and cheese pierogis and they were just as delicious as I had hoped. They also offer a breakfast pierogi and a few dessert options I hope to try one day.

f8MTKsozzYACw2fimAIswg.text: Guys. I am so sad to rate Stuff'd one star, but I seriously have no other choice.   I went with 3 of my friends for a birthday dinner. When we got there, there was literally one other table. I gave our birthday cake to the nice bartender who said she would be happy to help us when we were finished with dinner. Our waitress was friendly, and helped us decide which pierogies to get. The pleasant experience basically ended there.   After we watched the entire restaurant fill up, eat, and leave, our server came back to let us know that the kitchen lost our ticket, and we would be getting our food soon. My friend and I got the blueberry mint mojito. It was ok, but we never had the opportunity to get another one because no one really came back.   At least thirty minutes later, our food finally showed up, but we were missing an order of pierogies that didn't show up at the table until everyone was done eating.  Our server was very apologetic, and it seemed like she was having a rough day, but everything about this experience was awful.   We all got cheeseburger pierogies boiled - if I were just rating those, I would have given them 3 stars. We also got fried mac and cheese pierogies, and they were doughy, covered in slimy sweet onions, and nacho cheese. I wanted them to be bomb, but they weren't and it was sad.   When we asked for help with the birthday cake, it took like 15 minutes, and all one of the servers did was drop it on the table in the grocery bag it came in and walked away. It kind of felt like something was happening all night long with the employees because as the night went on (we were there for over 2 hours), the service got worse and worse. We ate our cake as quickly as possible, our server told us our meal was comped (except for our TWO drinks) and she would be back with our check. FIFTEEN minutes later, and we still didn't have a check so another server just told us to leave. It was a real drag.   TL;DR, this place has a lot of kinks to work out, but I hope they do. It will be a long time before I think about going here again, but the concept could be really cool.

7DtclbXA-cBbUFQHxE0Okg.text: We ordered a Burger, Pittsburgh Salad. Loaded Fried and the buffalo pierogies.....Took forever to get food but was surprised to see that pierogies were homemade...and filled with buffalo chicken.....Loaded fries were the best actually..

ndVfQzLoZl16cLvC03-e9A.text: Very underwhelming pierogis that left me feeling Stuff'd with nacho cheese overload. The concept is there I will give them that, but this place just wasn't doing it for me. My coworkers and I arrived around 11:30 and the place was not busy at all. They basically only have 1 picnic table, a couple of booths in the back and a couple of barrels turned into high top tables. We ended up sitting at the very uncomfortable high top tables. I'm a girl that likes to cross my legs to sit and that wasn't going to happen sitting around a barrel. I will point out they do have a very nice bar area though (1 of the positives).   You get 6 pierogis that are a decent size, just not worth the price or flavor left on your taste buds. I originally wanted to order the breakfast pierogis until I seen they were $16. I am a frequent brunch goer and I have tried many different spots in and around town. My brunch entrees are never $16 so I couldn't justify it for pierogis. My coworker did end up getting them and he said they were not as good as he had hoped.   I ended up ordering the Mac n Cheese pierogis "boiled" because I am a big fan of Mac n Cheese. I was pretty disappointed when she brought out my plate to see large amounts of nacho cheese dumped on my plate. It also comes with sauteed onions which I'm okay with, but I'm not sure it went well with the nacho cheese. It also comes with a side of sriracha sour cream. I left it right in its origin... on the side. Sriracha sour cream and Mac n Cheese just don't belong together in my opinion. For the pierogis themselves I was hoping to see the potato filling along with the elbow noodles stuffed inside. It was basically a pierogi stuffed with buttered noodles and that's it.

I hope it changes and quickly or it will shutting its doors due to no customers.

31dQMy1nVv8BljIQjNqPmg.text: Unique concept!  The Pierogi bar was a fun place to grab lunch.  They offer 1/2 orders of the pierogis here, so I went with 3 spring roll and 3 Rueben.  Perfect for the woman who wants it all.  I got them boiled, and they were lightly pan fried.  I think I should have got the spring roll fried.  The spring roll was not even close to being as good as a real spring roll.  So I don't recommend but I appreciate the creativity.  But the Rueben was fantastic.  It was a meant to be combination.  Great beer selection.  I couldn't resist getting the Evil Genius Purple Monkey Peanut Butter and Chocolate Porter.  Very good surprisingly.  Service was friendly.  Fun place all in all.

YjwhRsCKQSJ8gyVx9Fepig.text: When I heard a pierogi bar popped up in downtown Pittsburgh, I was pretty excited. I was so glad to see that it wasn't yet another taco place. Then I saw all the bad reviews, which I'm glad I didn't listen to.   I think by the time I came here for lunch, they might have figured out some of the kinks because I enjoyed my experience here. The service was quick and we were in and out in an hour. There were so many interesting choices (such as chicken parm, mac and cheese, pulled pork, cheeseburger) and it was so hard for me to make a decision. I ultimately ordered the reuben pierogis and they were so good! The pierogis were filled with corned beef and cheese, topped with sauerkraut and dressing. You have your choice of boiled or fried pierogis, which "boiled" is actually boiled and then pan-fried and "fried" is deep fried.   I will say that this was an expensive lunch. For $16, I only got 6 reuben pierogis. I didn't see much on the menu for under $10. I may come back if I've got a hankering for pierogis, but for the price alone, I don't see myself coming back often, especially for lunch. If price isn't something you're worried about, this is a pretty cool place and definitely worth trying!

P2QUKpSn92qYwnl37EAs5A.text: After being told there was a 45 minute wait across the street at Proper, my 9-year-old niece and I came here for dinner before a show at the Benedum. We were seated almost immediately. Even for a picky eater, we were able to find food for my niece that she LOVED (house salad, potato cheese pierogies, and "the best French fries" she's ever had. I had the sauerkraut pierogies which were delish. We both only wished we could have taken our leftovers to go! Service was a little slow and we had to ask for things we probably shouldn't have (like wiping off the table, extra plates, bringing our salad before the rest of the meal)...but if you're ok with a casual dinner before a show, this place is great.

0fKJ4tY-cQkrcHxR0g1cEA.text: Great bite to eat! Lots of unique choices to choose from. Jenna, our server was very personable and friendly. From out of town, but will definitely be back!

jVk8NgCv66YSMgt_zB4NQA.text: I wanted to love this place - I really did - I just didn't.  First of all, if you're going to call yourself a pierogi bar in Pittsburgh you better have the best damn pierogies in town and sadly these were not. Don't get me wrong they were ok just not out of this world delicious. Kinda spendy too.  I thought they'd have more on the plate for the price which I would've happily paid if they were the best damn pierogies in town but they were not.     I had the buffalo chicken and hubby got the chicken parm-the buffalo chicken was too saucy so you couldn't really enjoy the flavors since everything else was so overpowered by the sauce - hubby's chicken parm was better.   With so many great places in town to eat we'll probably, sadly, never come back but glad I tried it at least once.

Y4MbBr1dy8WSB_3TcC1hWQ.text: What a great experience. We saw the 3 stars reviews but couldn't pass on such a creative dining experience. Best decision of the trip.  Heather was a gem  and made the whole meal a 10!

rkXMbsrRKvJ9yvGnG1wqIA.text: Went there in 7th ining of pirates game Asked for potatoes and cheese they were out asked for saurkraut and cheese They were out so we ordered 2 beers and asked if they could turn on the last few innings of the game but they didn't know how to turn the station  Might want to call ahead and make sure the have pierogies and if u plan on watching the game bring a remote just in case

Q19Oen7y-NY2nZ7dRZJxxQ.text: I and three friends had lunch here and it was just great.  There is a variety of pierogis and they are quite creative - we had the reuben and it was amazing.  I wish I had been hungrier.  The portions are large and one order of six fills you up.  In fact, I shared it with someone and it was plenty.  There is a full bar and it's nice to enjoy pierogis with a glass of wine, which is not possible in many pierogi places.    The location is in the middle of downtown Pittsburgh, so you have to be down there already or it's kind of a pain because you have to drive and find parking (in a big garage, in our case).  Probably the people who go here work in the area or are going to the theater.  It's in the theater district.  I would go back because I thought the food was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu 2
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu 1

TPRPnjuC9CvPke4s8BidVQ.text: The potato and cheese pierogis here get 4 stars! I had them boiled and fried and they're delicious. I tried the spring roll pierogi and I'm glad i ordered the cheese ones first or I would've been pretty disappointed. The service was great and the drinks were strong.

q0BJPzoH2FsZnTQf7GSzfA.text: This is a great little find. The food was amazing, but be aware the portions are HUGE. The staff is nice attentive and friendly. A must return for ya when back in Pittsburgh.

lbaaE3CgCy0Y7PzMA02snA.text: Me and co workers saw this place featured on Facebook and I thought I would give it a try.  The interior was really nice. Reclaimed wood, Edison light bulbs and a killer bar. All so far a plus.  Menu is simple showcasing that the name of the bar is pierogi. Many to choose from. I love saurkrat and potatoes. They were all that I wanted and more. Topped with chives and caramelized onions. And under the pierogi was a like of saurkrat. That buttery goodness.  Yum it was worth the price. The prices here are a little higher. But the quality and portions make up for it.  A cool idea is for the bar to create a sampler platter to try them all.   I would recommend trying this place. It's new and neat concept plus a Pittsburgh favorite dish.  They are still new so limited drink menu. I will have to come back and see of they do some cool drinks to go with the theme.

Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar. Great for a happy hour
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menus

AbHnP5MBaHNXRlQS_NQS7A.text: This is the worst place I've ever been it's going on 1.5 hours to get our food. Granted the bartender was super nice (the star is for her) and she warned us they were backed up. We got here at 7 (no long dinner rush hour) and it's now 8:40p still no food.

aujf4Ca7QrpLDRh8MFTDLg.text: A great concept that was poorly executed. My friend and I came on Friday for their soft opening. The restaurant is well decorated and has a warm feel to it. We were given menus and I was surprised to see that they had their full menu out. They have a wide variety of pierogies to choose from the classic potato and cheese to buffalo chicken. The prices are on the higher end as 6 pierogies are $12-$16. We decided on ordering the potato and cheese pierogies and the spinach and feta pierogies. No one had taken our order for a while and then finally our waitress came over and said "I am so sorry. I forgot about you." I was slightly appalled I have never heard a waitress say that. Anyways, she said there would be a wait, because they just opened.   Well, we did not realize how long this wait would be. We came in at 8 pm and at 9 pm, we still did not have pierogies. They also do not have any appetizers, so we could not even munch on anything. At one point, our waitress comes over and says that she is so sorry, because somehow the cooks did not get our order slip. By 9 pm, my friend and I were ready to leave, but luckily we saw her coming with our food.   So the pierogies were alright. I was expecting amazing out of this world pierogies as that is the only thing they serve and they were just average. The potato and cheese ones were lacking flavor. The spinach and feta ones were unique, but the stuffing was so little. For the price we are paying, I expected better stuffed pierogies. Also, my friend found a hair in her spinach and feta pirogues, which then turned us off.   Unfortunately, I do not think we will be back. I was very excited for this place to open, but after our terrible experience I don't think I can recommend it. It was probably our worst dining experience ever in Pittsburgh. I realize it was a soft opening, but they were clearly not ready to open. Maybe in a couple months, they will have their act together.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The spinach and feta pierogies
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The potato and cheese pierogies

JsxLQApHBCyArwk025duGQ.text: Nice bar/layout. BIG portions, but on the overpriced side. I had the philly cheesesteak ones and then split some of the potato & cheese. Both very good, slight edge to the potato, but hey, I'm a purist. Definitely not 4 or 5 stars because service (including the lone bartender who kept disappearing downstairs) was painfully slooooowwwww and there was a bit of drama between the wait staff which they didn't care if customers heard or not. That and some hoochie mama bartenders from the adjoining club came in and out a few times. All things considered, a little low brow. Sorry. They had the UFC fight on at least, so...4 stars it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8qI5Dj0B-lXRg0H37V1kxA.text: Waited forever to be seated despite open tables, the service was terrible and unhelpful. When we ordered food not only did we wait forever but it also came out cold. Waited 20minutes to get water refilled. The bathrooms were gross, my girlfriend had to hold her door closed because the locks were broken. Which such a great location you'd think the management would take better care of the place. I'd highly recommend avoiding this place. Big disappointment.

WRcx9iT5-t-UbRomaoW5TA.text: We'd heard about Stuff'd and it was our restaurant of choice on our overnight trip to Pittsburgh. We hadn't realized that it'd be packed with impatient baseball fans trying to get to the Pirates game. The wait was going to be too long, so when they offered us a space downstairs we jumped at it. The restaurant expansion isn't exactly finished yet but our group of 8 didn't care - we were there for the pierogis, not the decor.  We were actually served by the general manager, Carl, who went out of his way to give us an excellent experience. The kitchen was really backed up and it took us quite a while to get our dinners, but Carl checked in on us often and made sure we were happy. He could not have treated us any better and he definitely made us feel valued and important. We enjoyed chatting with him and appreciated his time and attention.   We all had an excellent experience - amazing food, outstanding service, and a fun memory of Pittsburgh. Thanks, Carl!

lafEsX5oXTmQGCfgfHStKw.text: We loved this place!   Visiting from Florida for the Pittsburgh Marathon, we were looking for some local food.  This exceeded our expectations.  Great vegetarian selection.  Word of advice, the portions are big.  We over ordered!  We loved Stuff'd so much we came back a second day!

nqZxxDHrGWiDLw13HO_Z-w.text: How is this place still open? Four of us went this past Saturday. Got there at 6:30 and figured we'd have to wait for a table. As an aside we tried calling four times during the day when they were open only to not have anyone answer and it go to a full mailbox. Anyway when we got there we were told we'd either have to wait for a table upstairs or go downstairs which is still being remodeled. We decided to wait. I did look downstairs and it is definitely still in the remodeling phase. Exposed wires and bare walls all around. A table opened up upstairs and we were seated in about 15 minutes which wasn't bad. Then the problems really started. Ordered drinks and food right away because we heard about the wait. Drinks came about 10 minutes later. The beer tasted like something was wrong with the line. Probably hadn't been cleaned for a while. Salad appetizer came about 30 minutes later. Meals didn't come for over 1 hr after we ordered. Our waitress tried her best to be attentive to us but that didn't help with having to wait this long for pierogies.   I had summed it up to a place that opened too early and they hadn't worked out all the kinks, only to be surprised that the place has been open for over one year!  My only conclusion is this has to be a front for some laundering illegal money. There's no way a restaurant that is this terrible in customer service can still be open. Which is really a shame because the food is pretty good and it's a neat concept for restaurant. Maybe a real restauranteur will take over the place and make it a real restaurant.

4foNbSdEj_YxEYJM362Wag.text: We loved this place! We were visiting from Los Angeles and knew that we had to have pierogies while we were here...... so many delicious options (lots of vegetarian ones, which is so not the norm in any non veggie restaurant ) it was hard to choose.  We enjoyed the Mediterranean, taco and cheeseburger ones.  There are 6 large pieces in every platter and as delicious as they were we had leftovers.  Next time we visit we will eat here again, the service was great, prices were right and the food was delicious.

Lsz77jt3nIIilFWLQGy29w.text: Just spent over 90 minutes waiting for our food. The wait staff blamed the long wait time on Uber Eats orders that apparently took precedence over customers waiting in the establishment. This was the excuse that was giving after we complained and tried to say it was busy when we where the only ones in the restaurant.  Very disappointed. Not coming back.

EbSFbwAXnFoWQOx8-o9DxA.text: I have not had a perigee since 1973. This brought back so many memories. Erin was absolutely great at answering our questions and making recommendations.

pNYh8_dCW-r__BzrfrJqlQ.text: The food was good but the service was distasteful to say the least. My friends and I had an apartment viewing to go to, but my friends card got declined, so I offered to pay with cash. We were in a hurry because we were late so I told the middle aged blonde waitress it's okay just use my cash we have an appointment. She comes back and proceeds to give me attitude because she was "just trying to help". That's great but I'd rather not watch my friends card get declined ten more times and miss my appointment. Other people waited in the doorway for fifteen minutes before just seating themselves because no one paid attention to them. Needless to say the staff is unprofessional but the Pierogis are really good.

qGPr_VKYMtcyW5_4mAxZcA.text: Yummy food-- old meets new Pittsburgh with their body pierogi selection! Laid back vibe with a good beer selection. The servers were friendly and helpful, especially Kat behind the bar. Made it in and out in time for our show. Look forward to visiting again.

TN0hqvcO5ehWQW1cFVo-aw.text: Stephanie was our server ! She recommended amazing dishes ! Food was excellent ! Service awesome !  Atmosphere is quaint! Highly recommended !

Y7MToXu0uHblsY_W5B8Vyg.text: An awesome taste of the 412 with a special twist!  Stuffed perogies that are so good, you will want to don a babushka and dance the polka!

fZOs5XB5jWWTKgTgFsJdzA.text: Great place, good food, great service. First time trying a pierogi (yes I'm a tourist ) thoroughly enjoyed!

iT2wGM_R51hMuj7b0PBjXQ.text: Great service and awesome customer service! Kept the drinks full and the pierogis rolling out! Met one of the workers after we left on the train and they followed up to ask how our food and drinks were! AMAZING PEOPLE

fI9sRcklkv-qDaVW3wxmcw.text: We walked in this evening and was ignored by everyone working - no one wanted to sit us. On the way to getting seated, we overheard two servers complaining about something and one saying how awful the day was. We ordered our food and it came out just as the bubble machine from the club next door started pouring bubbles into the street. The bouncer was cool though and shut them off when we asked. The french fries came out cold and old. Our server was clearly ignored and audibly sighing when we asked for a fresh basket. She also seemed extremely upset we dare ask for forks and knives. The potato and cheddar were pretty good. The ranch dressing is really good. The other orders at my table were "ok" - sweet cabbage, Reuben, and breakfast. Beer prices high. Just very bad service all around. We're pretty sure at least one of the workers was high.

tPG9gsCzJhT4Gq1PWb3CRQ.text: Stopped in early on a Weekday to get lunch. Place was dead. Nice old wooden bar front, probably a hold over from whatever the place was last time. Service was meh. Sat at the bar and the discombobulated bar tendress spent most of the time training a new employee and complaining about the day. She looked hungover . Anyways. These aren't pierogis. I got the standard boiled pan fried ones with a basic sauerkraut topping. They were definately fried yesterday and heated up today. Get a box of mrs t's and you would be in better shape. Wouldn't come back.

HLfWBL8Ge1uU0NKtiM_zIg.text: We had the traditional pierogi and it was really good :-). Like this place! We are not from here so it was a good food to eat :-)

v-M6pJNfPyA5SBeHVT1XhQ.text: If you are serving pierogis in PGH you need to step up your game immediately!  I'm hoping that our experience had to do with the soft opening status....although they have been open a month.... My family LOVES pierogis. We were so excited to go and even planned our entire day around this place.  I was actually angry when we left. Here are some bullets to sum up the experience... -when we walked in the manager was yelling at a cook in front of the door -none of the staff smiles. I could write the entire review about the staff. -they ran out of chicken -they ran out of mini pierogis for the salad so they just didn't bother giving any. So it's $16 for lettuce. -our food was wrong when it came out and when they corrected it- it came back wrong again. -I paid extra for a fried egg. I got a burnt egg that was hard and not edible. -the pierogis were still frozen on the inside. Those not frozen were just cold.... - my 9 year old said "This place is gross." -the manager apologized while looking off into space and then greated other customers mid sentence....but....the only good part of the night is that he gave us a discount.

EUcbI6kxjubFl_ezj-kKcw.text: Visiting my daughter in Pittsburgh and found this restaurant on Yelp. Being pierogi lovers, we couldn't wait to go for dinner. Arrived about 7:30 on a Sunday evening and there were very few patrons in the restaurant. Took about 45 minutes to finally get our order and let me just say, we were extremely disappointed. My deep fried pierogis were so over fried. The pulled pork was delicious but couldn't make up for the bad pierogi. My daughters' boiled/pan fried pierogis were rubbery and cold.  It took so long to get our food and we had plans afterwards we didn't have time to even ask for the pierogis to be reheated. We asked for the check along with our meal. While the food was a major disappointment, our waitress was very friendly and apologized over and over for the delay. Don't think we will be back. Took our meals to go but tossed them in the trash as soon as we got home.

3RvXRbUb__vN8hKLK0vjUA.text: This pains me to write this review.  I have been a big fan of Stuff'd since it has opened. However, the last few visits over the past several months have been disappointing.  I have just chalked this up to being a "one off," but sadly I can't give them the benefit of the doubt anymore.  I go to Stuff'd during lunch if I am in Pittsburgh during the week, and I take out of town guests here as well.  I also have Broadway season tickets and loved stopping here on Saturdays after the show.  Over time, the patronage after shows at the Benedum has dwindled significantly.  Basically, no one goes there anymore after a show. It is easy to get a table on a Saturday night.  I have always told co-workers to stop here for the pierogis, as they have been delicious. Buffalo chicken, cheeseburger, and reuben have been my favorites, although I have never had a bad meal here.  The pierogis, fries, and haluski are delicious.  But our last visit at 10 pm on 2/2/19 was baffling.  What is happening to the service?  The reviews are speaking for themselves, but no one seems interested in correcting the staff's behavior.    1.  The restaurant is freezing  2.  We were seated, and although waitresses kept passing us, we never got our drink orders taken or even acknowledged.  Finally after almost 10 minutes and making eye contact with someone, she came by and asked if we were taken care of.  3.  The girls at the bar are more concerned with hosting a frat party with their friends at the bar than conducting business.  We finally got our food order placed.  Then there was a drunk, loud, aggressive, and belligerent patron who continued to move from staff person to staff person, being very loud, singing, and making racist comments.  Staff kept glancing at us but said nothing, nor did they do anything to calm him down.  We were later told he comes in frequently and acts like this, and he works next door at the club.  4.  The lights are out in the women's bathroom, and in the hallway to the bathrooms.  Then randomly, two girls walked into the restaurant from the back door!  The bartenders must use this entrance for friends because it was clear they were not staff.  After 30 minutes, we asked about our order and was told she would check on it.   About 5 minutes after that, we realized one of the staff that the man was spouting off to was the cook!  So no one was actually cooking our meal this whole time?  We threw $5 on the table for our waters and left.  We went across the street where we were seated immediately, given our drinks, and our order was taken immediately.  We were treated the way restaurant patrons should be treated.  We also quickly got a very delicious pizza.  My past experience with Stuff'd is what kept us sitting there for 30 minutes in this frat party.  They also were not bussing tables or concerned about dinner patrons at all.  While we were across the street, we were told people routinely leave Stuff'd with the same complaints.  I hope the management and owners realize the staff is running this into the ground.  I would hate to see this place close.

imeOO-IsPq7ZaA3Gcd7U3w.text: I came for dinner with a friend last week and we enjoyed our experience. It's definitely a bit spendy for pierogies, but if you are going to a pierogi bar downtown, you should be expecting the trendy factor to cost you more than buying them at a local church fest. The interior is beautiful and I loved the whole ambiance of the place. We were the first to arrive for dinner, right around 5:30 and after about 20 minutes, the place was packed!  They have extensive options, so everyone should be able to find an option they like. Mac and cheese, cheeseburger, reuban, veggie, cabbage... you can be as plain or exotic as you like! I love that they offer the option to have them fried or boiled too. We split orders of fried potato and cheese and boiled cheeseburger and really enjoyed both, although I always prefer the boiled over the fried! Each order comes with 6 pierogies, which was surprisingly enough.   The best part of our experience was easily the service. Our server, Amber was amazing. She was very polite, personable and extremely attentive. She made sure to keep our drinks flowing and took great care of us overall.

n2JjSFWc6Y-dkBdqnbJ6Mg.text: *sigh* I waited a few weeks and decided to give it another try for an early Sunday dinner (non-game day).  I stand by my prior opinion that the pierogis are really good. The food isn't the issue. It is managing the inventory and staff. After being open on a weekend without major Pittsburgh sports, they were still out of so much of the menu. Not to mention half the taps were empty.   It started with the drink list. There should be a drink list by now. Having your waitress hand you her order pad to read the bottled beers and wine is not my idea of professional. And the service is just plain bad. The staff was unpleasant and continually interrupted us. There was also a very strange encounter with a man (manager maybe?) when one of the diners commented (to himself) that $13 seemed pricy for 6 pierogis. (I agree, a bit pricey, but as I've said, they taste good.). I was with several first timers from out of town who were really excited about the place.  It reiterated that I won't be back. When we got there there was only one other couple in the place. It got busier, but t wasn't crowded by any means. Dishes and drink glasses were never cleared, and it seemed like we were just an inconvenience to the staff. This isn't a new problem, this is the same issue with the prior iterations of the restaurant. It is a shame because the concept is a good one. I work a block away, this could be a go-to place for my coworkers. They need to bring someone in to help with the execution or it is going to suffer the same fate.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato and cheese pierogis

RtGko3gFMX_K2ZIPFYh-cA.text: Easily the worst service I've ever had. There were two waitresses working and they continued to walk past our table and neither offered to take food or drink orders and then the bus boy finally asked our drink orders. Both girls seemed annoyed to be there. We waited nearly an hour for our DRINKS. Which were three waters and a sprite and the girl who ordered the sprite never did get it. When we finally had the opportunity to order food we asked for our check at the same time as we didn't want to wait another hour for it as well. We had to wait to track down silverware after we got our food and our request for the sour cream the menu states the pierogies come with was met with an eye roll. It was also beyond freezing in the restaurant every time the door opened an arctic chill filled the whole place. The food was decent though it was lukewarm/cold by the time we finally received it. but the service was horrendous and we already knew we wouldn't be returning based on the length of time we waited for water.

rHauQeZh1GTLmsAdVKmTeQ.text: To say I was excited about a restaurant based on Pierogis is a bit of an understatement. This past Saturday I finally got a chance to check it out.   At first glance of the menu I knew it was going to be tough to decide among the plentiful pierogi options. Pulled pork, buffalo chicken, chicken parm, were strong contenders, but two of those options were sold out, which admittedly was a little annoying. Especially for it being a Saturday around 5p. But the food and vibe made up for it.  The pierogi traditionalist in me couldn't resist the pierogies with kraut.   They were friggin delicious. The kraut was sour and tangy, and the pierogis were perfectly puffed pillows of potato pleasure. Boiled then sauteed.   I enjoyed them with a profound intensity.  I also ordered the house salad which also comes with two deep fried Pierogis which was a great way to get my veggies in AND try the deep fried Pierogis. Best of both worlds if you ask me.  Stephanie, our waitress, was also amazing. She was friendly, attentive, and very sweet to my mom who Stephanie knew, recently lost her sister. Stephanie's kindness was a much needed breath of fresh air!  I'll definitely be back!

gJv3PjoPCsj0G15o1largg.text: Stopped here late on a Saturday night a couple weeks ago. Apparently this was during their "soft opening." Not sure when the official grand opening is. Seemed like they are still doing some renovations when we were there. Doesn't seem like a very big space but there are some tables and seats at the bar. Out waitress was very nice and service time wasn't terrible for us despite what some of he other reviewers said about slow service.   I think the concept of a place like this is cool but I'm not sure if it will be good enough to last. I think menu still needs a little work as the apps and sides weren't exciting so we didn't even get one. My husband's Asian style pierogi was tasty, it was soggy. The macaroni and cheese pierogi were tasted good. Basically, pasta stuffed in pasta with cheese. Was supposed to be served with a siracha sour cream but I tasted no actual siracha flavor. I'd be interested in coming back to see what it's like for the grand opening.

qyN5UnsHhvJj_lbW-NQgqQ.text: First time here was for my sister's birthday. We'll start with the good: we all really liked our pierogies! They only give you 6 but we were all full and satisfied by the end. No one had any complaints about their entrees. Now the okay - we got the special, the red hot onion rings - which weren't at all spicy hot, but they came out and were definitely red and temperature-hot. Decently crispy and bright red like Flamin' Hot Cheetos, but like any other rings otherwise.  Lastly the bad... which was most of the rest of our experience. We ordered stuffed cabbage as an appetizer to only get two "rolls," which were flavorless and disappointing. The cabbage was undercooked, and it seemed like marinara sauce was dumped over the top almost as an after thought. Our drinks were also terrible. Strong but mostly flavorless, like drinking rubbing alcohol. We drank them because we paid for them but would not recommend this place if you're looking for a good cocktail. Our waitress was also miserable and she seemed irritated by our presence. She tried to seat our table of six at a table that would have been a tight squeeze for four. She hardly came to check on us. And she was generally short and her tone was rude when she did interact with us. If we were to ever go back, it would probably be only for pierogies to go...

NqxyGZpFw0lOXqLwTJsniA.text: Stopped in last night, stood waiting for about a 1/2 hour.  No one stopped by to ask how many was in our party or anyone else that was waiting in line.  There was only a party of five ahead of us. 3 seats  had opened at the bar asked a waitress if a table was opening soon or should we take the bar seats?  Said we would be getting a table very soon so we offered the seats to people behind us.   Waited about 10 more minutes then the waitress told us that there was a delay in the kitchen orders and the food would be backed up for 45 minutes to an hour and still wasn't going to seat us.  We left.  Not sure if I'm interested in stopping back with

bVz6UtpKN8uRjbG-F1EcwQ.text: Growing up with pierogi and being Polish, I was very excited to see that this place was opening. My boyfriend and I went to their "soft opening" which didn't seem as low key as I expected. There was no hostess and we were called by the ONLY waitress to go find a table. We were not greeted for probably 20 minutes. The menu looked great and definitely unique. I ordered the pulled pork pierogi because I can't say I've ever seen that offered before.   Well...1 hour and 45 min passed and we finally got our food. Why didn't I leave like I saw many other people do? I don't know. I was still excited. Pierogi were soggy and not authentic tasting to me at all. They apologized of course however they really weren't that busy by the time we were still waiting for our food.   I'm sure its lesson learned and they're probably much better and hopefully more prepared now. But, if you're looking for authentic pierogi/ Eastern European food, this wouldn't be my first choice.

_CRTHZtcrdYzjkhZT1JASg.text: Like a few others, I can't comment on the food as I didn't get a chance to try it, but I'll share my experience.  We had been planning to go out with our group to celebrate my birthday and I picked this place after seeing a couple articles on it. Then, we saw on Facebook that their phone lines were down, so my wife messaged them to make reservations for our group. They replied in a timely fashion stating that they couldn't do the time we requested and offered up a few other times. She wrote back agreeing to the time, but we never heard back in the form of a confirmation. She messaged them again, crickets.   I had a dinner meeting a few days later right around the corner, so me and couple coworkers popped in to have a drink and confirm my reservation. The bartender staff was rude when we asked for a beer list, pointing to the taps, snarled when we said we weren't ordering food and then put menus down in front of us anyway. We were almost done with our beers by the time the manager came out, and after scrolling through what looked to be hundreds of Facebook messages, he stopped at one and insisted that he replied to my wife confirming our reservation (she never got it) and then put the phone up so I could see that he had replied, but I knew they never replied, she sent me a screen shot. He took my name, pushed our reservation back 15 min from what we originally agreed upon and we never heard from them again.  We changed plans last minute, had a great meal somewhere else, with much better service.

LUxi2CALCj8YIzcyiY0o-Q.text: We had a great first experience at Stuff'd! I had the spinach and feta pierogies and my husband had the cheeseburger ones. Both of us were really happy with our choices! The service was great too - we were shocked by how fast our food came out of the kitchen. We'll definitely visit again!

rF5Wzy9tMYZO7UqhzX5yog.text: I thought that the bar had a cute little charm to it. The waitress and the rest of the staff was completely overwhelmed but friendly. I did not care for the over abundance of shredded chicken on and inside the Pierogi. I couldn't eat it but the Mac and cheese was solid. I would give it another try for sure.

dplWEcZ4LWiPVQLn5AQepw.text: The food was great. I got the breakfast pierogis and they were delicious! They weren't very busy (lots of open seats and an open bar) but it took almost 40 minutes to get two orders of pierogis. The wait for food was a bit frustrating since they weren't busy, but the pierogis were worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast pierogis

5bbGv_MI3Quh6iJHfZvp9w.text: In an area of pretentious restaurants and cocktail lounges, this "bar" is a great find.  Pierogis and great whiskey.  Come here to feel welcome like in a local neighborhood bar and enjoy over the top comfort food!  Will come here again and again!

6yPVmidx4ObHZhhXqqeWdw.text: The food was delicious with a great selection. They actually fill the pierogis with whatever your flavoring is.  They are currently redoing the basement to make it into an additional seating area. It looks like it will be a nice addition.  Reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is we went here before a concert and we waited over an hour before getting our food. When we asked what was taking so long the waitress told us we should have been told by there hostess it would be a long wait. If we would have known that we would have come after the concert

2ORvO61Kuc6AgJvUZOvLuA.text: Very disappointed. First time trying a pierogi and safe to say probably will never try it again unless I make it at home myself or visit Poland. We only tried the vegetarian options one fried and one steamed. And both were terrible. Barely any filling and undercooked and just bleh. Needed to detox for 2 days. I can't speak about the meat ones they could have been better but if you have them on the menu then you should make them well. Service was ok. Water not refilled had to ask for it to be refilled. I can see the attraction as it's in downtown and it's a pub. Perhaps the pierogi taste better when you've had a few drinks... dunno.

cgJiYocv3F-1fqqdZ_VFQA.text: I first visited this restaurant shortly after opening.  I wasn't impressed, but friends convinced me to give it another try. We came with our three year old twins prior to a performance at the Benedum and were pleasantly surprised with how accommodating they were.  We were seated in a booth that worked perfectly for our family.  Our server was extremely helpful and friendly.  She let us know that even though they don't have a kids menu, they do half portions for kids.  Honesty, I wish more restaurants offered this option because my kids are more adventurous eaters than the typical kids menu. We ordered a kids portion of the Mac and cheese pierogi, chicken Marsala pierogi and chicken Parm pierogi.  Somehow the Mac and cheese ones ended up being buffalo chicken (surprisingly, my son actually really loved them).  Our server was extremely apologetic (even though it obviously wasn't her fault since they had the right sauce on them). One thing that struck me was portion size.  They definitely improved this from my first visit.  I remember feeling hungry after my first visit.  Not so now.  There are six or seven decent sized pierogi on every plate plus the toppings.  Very filling and tasty portions. The mac and cheese pierogi are exactly what you'd expect.  Pasta stuffed in pasta and covered in a creamy cheese sauce.  My kids absolutely loved them. The chicken Marsala ones were packed with flavor.  Shredded chicken inside with shredded chicken and Marsala sauce on the outside.  Mine were a tad bit dry, so I had our server bring me some extra Marsala sauce. I learned from our server that they make all the pierogi daily in their downstairs kitchen.  You could tell she was passionate about her job and pierogi the way she talked about the process.   Something important to know if you are going to the theater (since you can't bring food into the theaters) is that they will store your food for your until after the show!  Great to know for future reference because the portions really are filling. Overall, a great restaurant that I will definitely return to.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stuffed cabbage appetizer
