Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Marsala pierogi

V_Uv9Mi1iCjztzIkzLlDhg.text: Second time here wanted to give it another shot from our first awful experience. So bad. Took an hour and a half for basically slop. The server was nice but there is no reason for pierogi's to take so long. Really poorly run establishment. I got the buffalo chicken pierogis and this is what I got. They put a whole chicken on it basically probably to cover up the mess they served

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Paper thin absolutely nothing in them they just tossed a ton of chicken on top

wNYDnEhtn0-dUcU0X3gkyg.text: **update: it has actually been over an hour and still no food. AVOID AVOID AVOID. I am ONE person trying to have a pierogi!!  I've been waiting on my food for 40 minutes. I finally ordered a beer to soothe my nerves about how long this is taking. The beer is flat. I tel the bartender. She rolls her eyes and pours it out. I know they are stressed because everyone is pissed about how long the food is taking but you could at least offer to pour me a different beer?????

rjeY9GHd9RSGzeH7z13UlA.text: Food was amazing but the service was really pitiful. I came in a few weeks ago with a party of 6 we decided to try multiple kinds, (pulled pork were amazing). Every single one of us, even the first-time pierogie eaters loved the food, but the restaurant was still kind of dirty, and the server seemed untrained. It's a shame because this pot has great food and really loads of potential but I'll be pack in Pittsburgh soon and likely won't be able to leave without stopping by once.

8zRMwr0YeJMunz936AodKQ.text: I was super excited to come try Stuff'd Pierogi Bar, I actually drove over an hour with my family just to come try Stuff'd. I wish I hadn't. What a waste of time.   Like others have stated, there wasn't a hostess and it took forever to be seated. There looked to be only one poor girl who was the waitress, hostess, and bartender! Clearly that wasn't her fault, and for everything she was doing her service was as good as she could provide.   As for the food, it was not good. Very overpriced! $12 for 6 pierogis. I ordered the potato and sauerkraut pierogi, which stated on the menu that they were Stuff'd with potatoes and sauerkraut, they were not. I ate one and realized they were potato and cheese pierogis and when I asked the waitress why the menu stated otherwise she said "for as long as I've worked here the potato and sauerkraut pierogis were potato and cheese pierogis topped with sauerkraut" this restaurant is called STUFF'D and they can't even bother to stuff the pierogis to match the description of the menu.   Not only that, but our visit was over TWO hours long! It was about an hour until our order was taken and it took another hour to get our food! And when we did finally receive our food, 5/6 dishes were barely room temperature.   I would not recommend Stuff'd to anyone.  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention that I found PLASTIC in my food! I'll attach a picture of my leftovers because I was too hungry to take a picture to start with because it took 2 hours to even get my food!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QiptDqD46_L5sAxIKppEtA.text: This place is NOT interested in your business!  Had some time before a show at the Benedum, figured we would give it a try.  Walked in and saw everyone working there standing around and taking behind the bar. Waited a bit, no one acknowledged us, so we assumed we would seat ourselves. We started to walk past the bar, then someone finally looked at us and said "we'll seat you!"    We went back to the entrance, and noticed that there were two tables staring at menus with no drinks or food. They both looked pretty frustrated. One person behind the bar was watching the other climb the ladder, then spent some time talking to her friend who was leaving. She did not bother to look at us or seat us or do anything else to secure us as a new customer.   A table from the back got up to leave, frustrated at the lack of service, and the table near us was desperately trying to get someone to wait on them. The employees remained steadfast in their commitment to ignoring all patrons and talking to each other. Reading the room, it was clear that if we ever got seated, we would never get food. We left, never to return.

m4Wpdr-eAROZttjF87DoLw.text: Oh Stuff'd, I had such high hopes for you. When I heard there was going to be a pierogi restaurant in town I was beyond thrilled. I started to hear from many people that it wasn't good. I thought to myself...I'm not picky about my pierogi's so there's no way I can be disappointed. Sadly I was proven wrong.  I went in with high hopes and everything on the menu looked amazing. It was hard to pick between all of the options. After much debating between the mac n cheese and buffalo chicken I ended up going with the buffalo chicken. After hearing what my coworkers had to say about the mac n cheese I think I actually got the better pierogis's. Their plates came out completely smothered in what looked like can nacho cheese and onions. You could hardly see the pierogi's under all the cheese.   As for my buffalo chicken pierogi's, they sadly were a disappointment as well. When I think of different variations of pierogi's I expected there to be some resemblance to pierogi's with at least some potato filling somewhere in there. NOPE. No potato in sight for any of our pierogi's. At that point are they even pierogi's anymore?  One of the other main reasons I have given this place such a bad review is due to the prices. This isn't a high class restaurant so who wants to pay $14-16 for 6 pierogi's?! I probably wouldn't have been so disappointed if my terrible food was at least reasonably priced. Instead I got a terrible meal and I was out $16+ after my tip.  It's not often that I try to tell yelpers to stay clear of places. Even if I'm not a huge fan I will tell others to check it out because they may feel differently. That is not the case with Stuff'd. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

JVAUI37rmJUa-3_LhTzAnw.text: This rating is for the food only!!!!!  We got here pretty early so there were only two guys sitting at the bar. There was a bartender and a busboy. The bartender, Sheila, was nice enough and gave some suggestions for drinks. She then informed us that register was broke so she could either take exact cash or punch in our credit card. Ok, no problem. Technology breaks down all the time. We had our drinks and placed our food order then all heck broke out.   You see this place is right across from the Benedum Center so everyone looking for a place for dinner and drinks before the show will crowd a place super quick.   Well Sheila was overwhelmed. The busboy was trying to seat ppl and get them non alcoholic drinks but they could not keep up. Ppl were lining up at the door. Others were frustrated from lack of service and walking out. Then the best thing ever happened. My food came!!!  I got the pan seared buffalo chicken Pierogies and my husband got the chicken parmigiana deep fried Pierogies. Oh, my!!! These aren't your grocery store, mrs t's pierogies. These things were massive and there were six of them. I still feel them in my belly.   Unfortunately while we ate at the bar we got to listen to Shiela complaining about all the guests. "Isn't there s Burger King down the road?" "If they don't like it they can leave, I'm only one person."  We finished our meal and left.   At first i thought this was just a very bad night for this place. Maybe ppl had quit or call off work but talking to a friend and reading other reviews this is normal. I don't know what kind of staffing struggles this place has but they could do much better with their quantity and quality of employees.

jW4uRUmMLwz4HJIDiaenZw.text: Just got into town and wanted to find a local restaurant, ended up here and was not disappointed! We had the traditional potato & cheese, Asian spring roll and chicken Marsala. Did not love the chicken Marsala and the waitress, Heather, was more than accommodating and brought a replacement without hesitation. This is a great little place. There are vegetarian options (the pierogi dough is made with eggs), but their menu says they are working on a vegan option. They have a great selection of local beers. We were overall very happy with the food and service. Expect a hearty meal with generous portions. Recommend this fun little place!

1DLYAch_TLXeetZXhQaR7A.text: Ya'll worried me Yelp. After reading all the not so good reviews I decided I needed to check this out. I do appreciate the scoop on being able to order three and three when it comes to not just ordering one type of pierogi. Also these Pierogies come with zero sides. They're also pretty darn expensive for only six but they're good and that's what counts right?  I had the Mac and cheese fried pierogi and the spring roll one. They were definitely stuffed and jam packed with flavor. Will I be back? Yes. Did this place live up to the expectations and pleasantly surprise me? Yes! The staff here are also super cool. I got to meet the chef and he does stand by his flavors. Maybe all the people who wrote bad reviews went on an off day as the flavors were definitely on when I showed up.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q6L1qZy8yPgbh4rPj1LKDQ.text: Just a disappointment all the way around. Arrived on a Tuesday at 5:50 and was seated immediately. After waiting a bit, we asked for a server and seemed to thoroughly confuse the girl we asked. She finally came back and we ordered drinks, we were going to share a Pittsburgh salad with an extra side order of pierogies. We let her know that we had tickets to a show which is why we ordered quickly. We had to ask for the drinks and it was apparent that they had been sitting at the bar for a while. At 6:30, we inquired about our food. (The couple that came in in front of us were finishing their meal, as were the two couples that came behind us.) By 6:45, we asked for our check. The food never came and the excuses were lame.  Plus, it was freezing in this place. They had 2 heaters, one at the very front by the door and back by the restrooms. I took my coat off but left my scarf on. I ended up putting my coat back on as there was a constant draft.

ZvEEvchxHC2g0kTxpfhdUw.text: Came here with high hopes that the ratings were not accurate. However, they were right! The experience was disappointing. We came here during a weekday during lunch. We should have gotten the hint when there was no one at restaurant at noon.  Cons: (1) the food took so long and when it finally came, the waitress said that it took a while because they were taking pictures of our food. (2) the food was cold including our fries. (3) they counted one pierogi shell as one even though it was ripped and had no stuffing. (4) cheeseburger stuffing did not have much meat inside. (5) overpriced  Pro: (1) the potatoes and sauerkraut was not bad. (2) waitress was nice Overall, I wouldn't come back here. It's expensive and not worth the quality. It was nice trying the concept but not worth it.

yGIjpPhvF8CPNyX_rMK0_w.text: If you love Pierogies this is the place! So many different items on the menu that I never knew you could make with a perogie. Service was good also. Definitely worth trying. I had the Buffalo Chicken, wife had the Rueben and my son had Mac &  Cheese. All were delicious. I can never look at Mrs. T's perogies the same way now...

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LP9FFZG9ziwTU9BZDFQs-A.text: I consider myself to be a "yinzer", so a pierogi restaurant is right up my alley! The menu is quite extensive, with MANY different pierogi options that I never would have even thought of... surly something for everyone!  My friend ordered the cheeseburger pierogis and could not stop raving about them. I ordered the buffalo chicken salad, which included three deep fried pierogis, on top of lettuce and shredded chicken. Next time, I would just order the pierogis, as there wasn't really much lettuce to the "salad". Nonetheless, the pierogis served on top were very unique and tasty. The blue cheese dressing was also delicious  (not sure if it's homemade or not, but it was very good).  They also had a great drink menu which included many local beers, as well as fun cocktails. Overall, it was a little bit pricey for what I would consider a small portion, but we enjoyed the food and drinks and the Pittsburgh feel to the restaurant. I'm excited to go back again to try out some of the other option, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken salad

bD0QQIEqrD0bmcwco-lpzA.text: Worst. Service. Ever. Waited over an hour for food while other customers were being served. Whenever we asked, the waiter would reassuring us that it would be out in a minute..... but it never came. Me and my friend eventually left without ever getting our order because it just wasn't worth waiting for anymore.

YechBm4YFm7PfEhnKy40QQ.text: Pierogi's were very good. I had the pulled pork Pierogi. Hard to justify the price for the quantity. I shouldn't walk out hungry for $16.

5dZDYUnaC6E9iOdjs5Ib3w.text: Not bad, but not good. Average is the perfect word. Maybe I expected too much - but it is a Pierogi Bar right in the heart of downtown Pittsburgh. The staffed seemed a bit disorganized and the menu was disappointing. I got an order of the peach pulled pork and the pork on top was cold. They were also out of the vegetarian pierogis which didn't make sense to me at all... it was a Friday night. How does that happen? Also, why aren't they prepared fresh? Finally, they were out of several beers and had only one dessert option. Glad I went so I can warn people but that's really the only reason.

aihun0cNQgfLSvhIR-CsHg.text: Was in from out of town and excited to try here.  We were told right away the computers were down and we would need cash, but no big deal. We came in at 4:30 on a Friday and were only the third table occupied in the place.  We ordered salads, yet ended up waiting 40 mins for food.  When we got it, the meat and Perogis on the salads were cold. The waitress was not able to found when e waited or after the food was delivered so we could share our concerns.  When we were asking for bills, they weren't able to split our checks and when we voiced our problems, we were told by the waitress she couldn't do anything since we ate the food.  The food was sitting in front of us barely touched.  The manager did come and give us a slight discount, but we were pretty bummed about the dinner and service we had been looking forward to.   On the bright side.. their ranch and side of fries were very tasty! They were all I ended up eating.

4VA8V306299Ifs7FHB8x3g.text: we were seated fairly quickly. i looked on yelp before coming here and was very hesitant because of the bad reviews but i was pleasantly surprised! we got a very personable waitress and she was very nice! it did take a minute to get our food but the potato and cheese pierogi was very good! would come here again when in the area! proces are a little much for what you get though.

1fivRlid3aNBZsB17I-Cxw.text: As the concept is awesome I wasn't impressed. Maybe we caught it on a poor night however. I got the boiled cheddar potato pierogis and my friend got the boiled chicken parm pierogis. Both were undercooked and doughy. Likewise I wouldn't recommend ordering any sort of speciality drink. We got two martinis that were not made correctly. If I ever go back I'll try the fried pierogis instead.

9T4jWsxciOWlFzE7yBDiOg.text: I went there for lunch a week after their opening and thought the food was amazing. You get 6 pierogis and can do half orders if you want to try a few different ones. I got the deep fried Reuben and the pulled pork and they were both really amazing. The only downfall to the place is that it's going to cost $14-16 for 6 pierogis but you'll be full enough when you leave.

kIpjPUvQ5ro8DilEV0_UIw.text: This is really a 2-star experience, but the third star is for the wait and bar staff, who went above and beyond. We arrived at 6PM, place was nearly to capacity. Ordered drinks, which came quickly and were very good. Ordered food, fairly basic pierogi orders - we had a show to go to at 8PM, and didn't want to eat too much. After about 45 minutes, the food had yet to show, and our waitress looked upset. She talked to the manager, and made sure the order had gone through. At about 7:15PM, we were given some comped drinks, and were noticing that all of the guests around us (most of whom arrived after we did) were finishing their dinner already. The food arrived at nearly 7:30PM, which is really pretty ridiculous. But the wait staff was very apologetic, and very good to us all night. The food was actually pretty good - I'd eat here again if I thought the wait wouldn't be so long. And to top it off, the manager knew about our issue and never came by once to say anything? It would have gone a long way with us had they made time to talk to us.

wEOHVYxi534bSRSgEXO7oQ.text: We had the chicken parm pierogies and the pulled pork pierogies and they were great!  Plenty of food for your money too.

hglv1WVRQbLURpUhhcHmKA.text: Looked forward to trying this, but closed. Door unlocked and when we walked in, people around bar and told they were closed.

zUfikwMmgcYzXlL2Y12-jQ.text: The employees were fun and energetic the food was also excellent I was there for their soft opening so there was a little wait but I already knew that was going to happen so it was no big deal I loved the cheeseburger pierogis I will be back :)

iYe2Hd6E62-FCUZPcShxNQ.text: We must have arrived at Stuff'd restaurant's busiest time as all the tables and bar were occupied. Seating capacity was under 60. We were given the option of sitting on stools at a bar area that seated 4. Being excited to try this new restaurant - we accepted that seating arrangement. The area where we sat was a passing zone so traffic was great. We declined ordering from the bar and chose to share the new appetizer of Stuffed Banana Peppers. It was spicy as expected but somewhat cold thermally. We ordered the Mac & Cheese Pierogi and the Cheeseburger Pierogi entrees. As we waited, there was considerable turnover at the booths near our seating. People who came in after us in groups of 4 and 5 received their meals as we waited. Upon signaling our server, she apologized for the long wait and went to check on our order. We finally received our meals. My husband's Cheeseburger Pierogi (#6 boiled then sauteed) came on a bed of lettuce with sides of tomato and a pickle. There was a drizzle of sauce on the pierogis that tasted very much like Mickey D's special sauce. Overall, his meal was tasty. My Mac & Cheese Pierogis (#6 boiled then sauteed in butter with onions) were stuffed with elbow Mac and Cheese and placed upon a bed of what appeared to be Cheese Whiz. There were sides of sour cream as well as Sriracha sour cream. My Pierogis were quite flavorless except for the saltiness from the processed cheese. We optioned to share the Dessert Pie-rogi of #3 deep fried apple walnut "dumplings" with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel sauce. Once again, people came and went and we still waited for our dessert. Finally we summoned the server and told her to cancel our dessert order. She apologized again for the wait. As she was canceling our dessert order - it was brought to us. Our server had removed the dessert charge from our bill and urged us to enjoy the dessert. I acquiesced as my husband was presented with the bill. Then a second server/supervisor came over with our revised bill indicating a 50% discount on our bill (the Dessert charge had been completely removed). I do not plan a return visit to Stuff'd. BTW - I have Polish heritage so I was very excited to try this new restaurant and share a review with my friends near and far. I came away very disappointed in the service aspect but thought that the varieties of Pierogis offered appeared to be interesting. I was looking forward to trying them all during repeat visits. But that isn't happening.

Pjk3l4NzVuNMWscI_JcS5g.text: Even after reading the reviews, I still had high hopes for this place. However, I was sadly mistaken and should have listened a little closer to others who have visited this restaurant. The concept is great, and has so much potential to be a great place to grab dinner downtown. They seemed to lack direction and maybe management? When I was first seated we were immediately told they were out of several menu items, and that they were having supply chain problems. We were also informed they were still waiting for things such as a coffee machine, iced teas, simple things that should have been cleared up within the first week or two of business. Now I understand they haven't been open very long, but long enough that they shouldn't have so many problems and be out of so many things. We placed our order for several different Pierogis, two side salads, and one order of fries. 40-50 minutes later we finally got our COLD food. I would call the meals luke warm at best. I mean even the fries were cool. The food was however pretty good, I'm sure they would taste excellent if they were nice and hot like you expect your food to be at a restaurant. Our waitress was very nice, but not very professional.  I really hope this place can turn it around or I fear they won't be around for too long. I can't say I'll be returning unless I hear that things have changed there.

Gm313Qa-LpPj3S8zn86Zsg.text: Lobster Mac and Cheese pierogi was delicious! But just as delicious as the delicious pierogi and friendly, professional service was the well-stocked historic bar. Restaurant has a historic but informal vibe, with fantastic pierogis.

S6tTXsXTONJ1ME7U-SlBow.text: We came here to celebrate two birthdays. Big mistake. While the food wasn't terrible; the service and atmosphere were absolutely horrible. We waited over twenty minutes for "fresh brewed iced tea" while our server took a bike ride outside. I had to ask for refills, napkins and sugar for our tea. Every single employee at one point was not present in the building. One caused a scene about quitting and storming out the door. We were the only table in the entire restaurant and our food took well over 30 minutes. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone.

jEtg9H6paDFT-CiqEd3rDQ.text: Service was a little slow, but it was all worth it in the end. The Chicken Parm Pierogis were incredible.

POegfnfirUbKSvVUslQjOg.text: Went with a friend at lunchtime on a Friday - one of the first 3 tables seated. Were told they were out of one type of pierogi (it's like Dunkin' running out of donuts).  Ordered promptly. Waited over 30 minutes to see the table next to us (seated just before) served, looks and smells good. Waited another 10 minutes before we saw our food - had potato/cheese and the spinach/feta. Potato/cheese came with a mess of onions, the spinach/feta had very little stuffing.  Both were good - but not $12 and $14 good, respectively! Two servers were running between tables and the bar, watched plenty of people walk in, wait and walk out. While we were waiting on food, no one around us was eating either! Checks came immediately after the food (go figure) and then we had to flag her down to pay! Over an hour in and out for what was a mediocre meal and grossly overpriced. Service was abominable. Enter at your own risk, you won't catch me back there again.   Have since been chastised about giving them a chance, etc. but their initial launch was mid-August and they were easily open a month to "work out the kinks". At $14 a plate, they have bigger issues than kinks. Pierogis weren't even above ordinary. Check out the other reviews - you'll see glowing comments (likely friends/family) and then experiences just like mine. Oddly enough, the reviews on FB were removed.

IKKs2Q8kd4Kw10fifV9tNA.text: Daughter and I stopped by after Pirates game. Did not read the reviews until after we ate. We absolutely loved our pierogis. We ordered the cheese and potato and the pepperoni pierogi. Texture and flavor were great on both.  Plenty of carmelized onions Our waiter was attentive and kept our drinks full.  The comments on price confuse me. These are specialty pierogis...not Mrs Ts. $40 for 2 orders and salads is not out of line.  This is a unique place. We will definitely be back again!

JPG8q0rBPoouqcCXsl-5Pw.text: Food didn't taste fresh or like what I would hope a $14 pierogi would be. Fried  was super dry and not what we expected.  Boiled ones weren't flavorful. We spent $55 with tip on 2 orders and 2 beers and I was pretty bummed. Servers were not friendly and arguing amongst themselves. Just was an odd night there maybe

Mou1_0bCM5wG9moZIo61bQ.text: The service was very slow. The chicken in the buffalo chicken pierogi was dry. 16 dollars for 6 pierogies! They even charged me 3 dollars for ice in my drink.

wh5GrZ5VtJL60FNpK89Ukw.text: Food was great, especially the pizza Pierogis. However, this was the worst service we have ever experienced. This place needs to get it's act together and have someone on staff who can manage the rest and teach them good customer service. Went on a Saturday around 7. The place was very crowded and had multiple groups waiting to be seated. There was no hostess to take names. Instead multiple workers continually asked how many people in each group. Seating was a debacle, and we were told multiple times that we'd be seated "any minute." After any minute turned into many many minutes, my husband finally asked one of the workers how much longer since we'd been told the same thing multiple times. She proceeded to respond with an attitude, stating everyone seated is paying to be there and she had no idea how long it'd be. She then walked over to her coworkers, rolling her eyes and throwing nasty looks our way. Once we finally got seated, our waitress had an attitude as well. Every time we asked for something, such as a refill on water, or side of ranch, we were faced with rudeness as the waitress acted like we were a huge inconvenience. During dinner, people at the bar played a song on the jukebox that had foul language, asking a worker to turn it up. The worker turned it up so loud that we couldn't hear ourselves talk and multiple waitresses stood behind the bar, singing loudly with the customers. I felt like we were in a dance club. At the end of the dinner, the previously rude hostess/bartender began yelling at another coworker telling him people needed to do their jobs and using swear words. This made a scene and continued on, while another bartender told her to calm down. All of the workers were extremely unprofessional and unacceptable in the customer service business. I'm astounded that this place gets any business with how awful the service was but hope for the sake of the good food that they turn it around.

WqepWgV3fncThW-Nh1fNRg.text: I've been to Stuff'd twice and both times they were out of quite a few times on the menu. The first time, I went on a Sunday for lunch with a friend. There wasn't many people in the restaurant and we sat right at the bar. We quickly noticed it seemed like the two waitresses on staff were entirely overwhelmed. Like I said, the place wasn't crowded but they could have used another person. Anyways - it took a while to get our drink orders in. I snuck mine past the bartender and she didnt even ask if my friend would like one. Once we went to order, they were out of my first THREE options. As a vegetarian I was stoked to see how many options there were on the menu - but alas, I had to settle for the Mac n Cheese Pierogies. They were fine, not worth the $14 or $16 paid for them though. While we were there, I saw one couple walk out once they realized their only option were the mac n cheese pierogies- they also said they were vegetarians.  My second experience went a little better. I went with a male friend, on a week night - which is maybe why we were paid attention to a little more? There was a different bartender that night and he was very friendly and happy. They were again out of my first choice (the sauerkraut pierogies) and he offered to do the traditional potato and cheese with a side of sauerkraut. The traditional were much better than the mac n cheese and the sauerkraut was amazing. It had a bit of horseradish-ey mayo mixed in? Not positive - but it was good.  All in all, its a nice restaurant - but I've gone twice and they've been out of many options. The pierogies are also about $2.50 a piece - which isn't astronomical but its something to think about considering the chances of you getting what you want are slim. The closest parking garage also has a $15 weekend/night base rate - so if you plan on going to Stuff'd on the weekend or for dinner, thats another cost to consider. It quickly turns into an expensive night - and its unfortunately not all that. *shrugs*

acKqKvj7dwm2VY9MOEwZyA.text: Just visited this place and really enjoyed it. They're going through a soft opening and the service was a touch slow, but that seems more than reasonable while they work out the kinks (and it really wasn't that bad). My group ordered the breakfast pierogies, potato and cheese pierogies, and Mac and cheese pierogies; all boiled and sauteed (fried is also an option). All were good (though I could have done without the nacho cheese on the M&C ones), but the potato and cheese ones were awesome - we all agreed we'd get those exclusively next time. All the staff were very friendly. Definitely recommend!

jxJo8VJEetnjrtVtMIptQg.text: Stuff'd with disappoint. I went to Stuff'd with three of my co-workers on a Friday. We arrived at 11:50 and order at noon. By 12:45 we didn't have our food and no one had stopped to apologize or give us an update on our order. I asked our waitress to confirm what time she put our food ticket in and she finally apologized and indicated that "everyone came in at once" .......which does tend to happen at lunch time. I was told our food was on its way up the steps and that the manager was coming up at my request. The food still didn't arrive and the manager did not come up. We left at 12:50, hungry and with no lunch time left. Save yourself the time and stay out of Stuff'd. Pick up some Mrs. T's pierogis next time you're at the grocery store and you'll be better off......at least you'll get something to eat.

231INOVyhd5djUGyoZz7jQ.text: Had a reservation for a large group which they said they could accommodate. Place really isn't set up for bigger groups if you want to sit together comfortably. It was extremely hot in restaurant. Most of the group was served but 4 of the group had to wait an additional 10-15 minutes with no explanation.  Buffalo chicken pierogies were tasty but the shredded chicken on top was so dry it was inedible. Wanted to love this place but not overly impressed.  Will try again and order a different item.

m5LluLeo-HAQVwrWuEEv1A.text: Went there for lunch during the week and loved it! I had the sweet cabbage pierogis and couldn't finish them they were very filling! My dad liked it so much he and my mom went back for more!

cDDm1FtqoJ1zKQ0zaW1M_w.text: Only giving 1 star cause I have to. Nothing I can say good about this place. Heard about it and was all excited, I mean who doesn't love pierogies?!  With it being game day and only 3 other tables of people and it wasn't busy should have been our first clue. We sat down and was told someone would be right with us, we waited no one came so we got up and got our own menu. Waitress finally comes over first thing she says is it'll be easier to tell you what we do have rather than what we dont have and gave us some sob story about how their freezer broke and blah blah. So we order 5 plates of different kinds of pierogies and so the waiting began. An hour goes by still no food just lots of promises that its coming. We never did get refills on drinks, finally threw down a $20 and was getting ready to walk out when a guy who claimed to be a manager says he'll check on our food. Another 10 minutes goes by and getting closer to game time we still had to walk to the stadium so we walked out. So disappointing!! As much as I'd like to say I understand stuff happens I can't even bring myself to say I'll try another time.

ZLtouIYfGGsfdTsnKKus9A.text: My husband and I had three family members in town for the night from NY and CA and we thought we should take them for some authentic Pittsburgh pierogis. After calling Stuff'd multiple times to make a reservation and getting no answer (voicemail inbox was full), we thought to look for the restaurant's Facebook page, and saw a post there stating that their phone was out of order. Also, their FB page said they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more, anyway. We showed up at 6pm on a Saturday night for a party of five. The first thing we noticed was a high-top deuce with a big "reserved" sign on it (so much for only reserving for parties of 6 or more). After a few minutes, we were greeted at the door and seated. Several more minutes passed before the server came to our table. She told us that they were out of about half of the menu items: the reuben pierogis, the buffalo chicken pierogis, the chicken parm pierogis, the vegetarian pierogis, and a couple more. It didn't look that busy in there, but that was the excuse she gave for why the pierogi restaurant was nearly out of pierogis. She then disappeared for a while again. Eventually, we were able to place our order. My sister first ordered the pulled pork pierogis, but apparently in the meantime they had run out of those, too. Some of us ordered beer (the server did not seem familiar with the beer selections, and there was no printed drink list), and she had to check that they had what we wanted because several of the kegs had kicked, too. We then waited half an hour for our pierogis to arrive. When they did, my husband's order was not correct. He had ordered deep fried pierogis, but was served boiled pierogis instead - and then the server argued for a while that they were deep fried before admitting that she had made a mistake. Also, she had an extra plate of pierogis that none of us had ordered (maybe that's why they keep running out?), which she just gave to us. After serving our pierogis, she said "oh, here's my boss" and went outside to take pictures of a couple of guys on choppers while they loudly revved their engines right outside the door to the restaurant. Totally unprofessional! She also spent quite a bit of time chatting with the "reserved" deuce, who she said she was friends with (maybe that's why they were able to make a reservation despite the 6 people rule?), despite her claims about how weeded they were in there that night. The server did throw in one beer for free, which was literally the least she could possibly do to redeem herself. In short, the pierogis were good (not great, and we had to settle for whatever they actually had), and the service was pretty abysmal. Also, they were out of toilet paper in the men's room, and one of the sinks in the women's room was broken. It was really embarrassing that that's what our family will now associate with Pittsburgh restaurant service. I do not recommend Stuff'd.

H3WqUxknlsEDFSznaJQmNA.text: Great little place. Not sure about the other reviews, but the food is always good and the service is always great when I've been there. Pretty good prices for downtown in my opinion too. Definitely worth checking out.

Kuz4yFRC51dBqfYxpDSjBQ.text: Very disappointing... we stopped in for dinner before a concert.... service was delayed but friendly enough. They were out of most items on the menu. The table next to us was serviced cold, stale food. Just listening to their complaints and managements obnoxious response was enough for us.... we left.

53LXKEBVGGHVMvpDmifkJw.text: First impressions of Stuff'd the decor was nice and the staff was very friendly. We ordered the cheeseburger pierogi and Potato and Cheese pierogi. Both boiled and seared. They far exceeded my expectations. The potato and cheese were delicious but the cheeseburger were amazing and the 'stuff'd sauce' is so good. Our server was also great! I will definitely be back to try more.

Kr3D3FHjUjwAzmvdiGcR2g.text: This place is awesome! Absolutely loved the decor. Our server Amber was great.  The pierogis were awesome. Everyone at our table (there were 6 of us) ordered a different type and we shared so that we could get a taste of 6 different ones. They have a few kinks to work out , but only opened a few months ago. One was that we tried to call ahead to make a reservation however their phones are not working. Hopefully they will get that problem fixed asap. The draft beer list is just written on a sheet of paper.  The menu is slightly misleading. it says you can order boiled or deep fried pierogis. We really didn't want either, we prefer them to be boiled then lightly browned in a frying pan instead of just boiled. We did not like the idea of deep fried either. However we were pleasantly surprised when we ordered the boiled and when they came out they were boiled but then lightly browned in the frying pan, just the way we like them!!  I think the menu should state that so you know what you will be served. We loved it there and will definitely go back again. I recommend this place to anyone that wants to try some unique pierogis!

VL2T0zWOI3Cqw_ptMFoc4w.text: Our group of four got the 1) potato and cheese 2) spring roll and 3) Philly cheesesteak pierogies. All the food was really good however it took a very long time to come out, about 45 minutes after ordering. Also, the women's bathroom stalls were both not very clean. For those reasons it's getting 3 stars from me. I would probably go back again if I wasn't in a rush but it's definitely a meal you really have to be in the mood for!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Philly cheesesteak pierogies, spring roll pierogies, potato and cheese pierogies

cmkVs7E9j5-bbAt9Te0WjA.text: This was possibly one of the worst lunch experiences that Ive had.    The service was absolutely horrible.  Took 12 minutes to get seated after it seemed no one was working.  We were a group of 4 for lunch. They only had 1 server.  The place was empty.  That should've been the first tell.  After we got seated the  waitress talked to a friend who came into the restaurant for 15-20 mins before finally coming over to us only after we had said something.  She took our order and then we waited.     And waited..   15 mins to get our drinks.   40 mins to get our food.   My order was wrong, and everyone's  food was cold, and undercooked.  Took another 12 mins for them to bring me my food S they got it wrong the first time.  It was at least warm, but very undercooked.    TLDR I really wanted to like this place and have a great experience.  It's a cool concept and atmosphere.  But the service was some of the worst, and the food was was cold and undercooked.  I wouldn't wish this place on my enemies.

Z4nyIyjOd7Pff6NiOv4l5Q.text: Maybe worst restaurant experience ever and we didn't even eat. We were sat promptly, then waited 25 minutes before a server stopped by to get our drink orders. We immediately placed a very simple food order.... then we waited. Around 20 minutes later the server told us our food would be up in 2 minutes, 15 minutes after that we looked for someone to ask about our order and there was literally.not.an.employe....sight. What a mess. So we left. I should add the place was not busy. This was a Tuesday evening and there were maybe 3 tables sat with patrons.

ABxLy8qvdkvM-RXYl2_KcA.text: Went here tonight around 6pm. Service was very very slow. After peeing our food it took about an hour and 20 minutes to get our food. The restaurant was kinda busy, but nothing crazy. As far as the food goes, my peach pulled pork pierogis were pretty good and I enjoyed them. The buffalo chicken pierogis were OKAY but nothing to write home about. Overall service was slow, waiter was sweet but there was nothing he could do, and food was pretty good.

bJV-DFFOeCyyunAyPoHuAw.text: I went to Stuff'd around 8pm when it wasn't overly crowded. I can't imagine what it might be like when all the tables are full/ during peak hours.   My Pierogi's were good but didn't rock my world. I feel like I could have recreated the meal with a box of frozen pierogis and some shredded cheese. The fries on the other hand were a very tasty appetizer! For the quality of service and just ok/good food I don't think I will be returning soon.

QmGlNRqIxQ1AOPQ0ihUvhw.text: Not sure who named a bar serving some costco microwaved finger-food a Pierogi bar.

laYrTrcn7npf5PrQkHeG-A.text: This place really warrants 2 different reviews - one for the terrible service and one for the food.  There were tables that sat unbussed for the entire time we were there while they crowded six people into a table meant for four.  It was almost like they were fighting over who needed to clean the tables so no one did.  We were sitting at the bar but still couldn't get any service.  You had to ask for a refill every time or you were not going to get it.  The bartender wasn't even in the bar area half the time.    Now the food... We went specifically for the pierogies.  They were good but not as good as I had hoped.  I had the spring roll pierogies and really liked that sauce and stuff that came with them better than the pierogies themselves.  My husband had the macaroni and cheese pierogies and seemed to like them.  Despite the food being ok, I will probably not go back simply because of the service (or lack thereof).

g6RNjdak9-iBhcHwpfWnHg.text: Loved the food here when I was in Pittsburgh for a baseball game. The unique styles of pierogis really intrigued me. The place was ran well despite it being short staffed. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mcj4BVs0FyZ3EIxaSdQGXQ.text: We decided to head here for dinner one night after an event downtown and had been wanting to try it for awhile. Unfortunately, our entire party was underwhelmed by our food. Each of us ordered a different pierogi dish and I will say that the portions were very generous. In fact, I probably could've shared one order and been fine. The pierogis weren't bad but I feel like they took something amazing (pierogis) and dressed them up to the point of ruining them. I'd take some Mrs. T's pierogis cooked with butter and onions in a frying pan over any of their crazy pierogi dishes any day.  I will say that the dessert pierogis that we ordered were very good. They contained a sweet creamy filling and were drizzled with strawberry sauce.

APwF37uSFZf-BET3obHXqg.text: I looked up the reviews prior to our decision to come to this restaurant. We wanted pierogies but didn't want to drive. So, despite the lack of positive feedback, we decided to try our luck anyway. I'm so glad we did. We were greeted immediately by the friendliest server who asked where we'd like to sit. We preferred a booth to a high top or the bar. The only open booth happened to be way in the back, where it sounded like someone else had sat in an earlier review, so I was a little apprehensive. Our server got our water right away, while we looked at the menu. She suggested that if we were ordering pierogies to get that order in before we made our cocktails selection, since they take a while. The cocktail menu is limited, but that was fine, it was a lively offering either way. Our food came out in a reasonable time and was delicious. We had great service and warm conversation. The food was great, by the way. I don't know when I'll be back in Pittsburgh, but I'll definitely come back here when I do.

0bdvHd86Zu_1gs_WCJgOFQ.text: Happened to be in town and my coworkers and I wanted something that we couldn't get back at home and we picked this spot. It has the feel of a bar that happens to serve food but everyone was definitely there to eat. Goes without saying that there's a full bar and lots of interesting beers on tap.   Come here if you want a nice light meal. Haha!  Ok, so this is no diet food but it's fun and tasty.  The menu was inventive. Portions are HUGE. There were three of us and we all are big eaters. We ordered four plates of pierogi to share and we definitely could have been full with three. There's also an option to split an order of six pierogies into two kinds @ 3 each. That might have also been a wise option. Next time.  In order of deliciousness, we had the sauerkraut & onion, chicken marsala, lobster mac & cheese, and vegetarian pierogies. We all agreed that the veggie one was the least tasty but we were happy to have some vegetables to at least pretend that we made an effort at a balanced meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Top half of the menu 6/2018
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clockwise from left, sauerkraut, lobster mac, vegetarian, chicken marsala

E5Vk6IFIRGun9NYzB8apvg.text: I was very impressed with Stuff'd! The staff was super friendly and helpful. We walked I. Around 5:30, 6 on a Saturday night and it really wasn't too busy. It did start to pick up a little around 7 though. There didn't seem to be too many tables that could fit larger parties, but they accommodate. Very nice ambiance and the tables are large.  My table ordered drinks to start - a red sangria and 2 blue moons. The sangria was delicious, served in a wine glass. The Blue Moons tasted a little off, like more citrus-y than usual, but not a big deal!  We ordered a plate of pierogis each so we could all taste a few different types. We got the peachy pulled pork pierogis, the taco pierogis, and the spring roll pierogis. The pulled pork and taco ones were a huge hit - stuffed with meat and then loaded with meat and toppings. I had the spring roll pierogis and the only issue I had with them was that they sat in the soy sauce. I think if you're able to ask for it on the side, I would. It sort of overpowers the pierogis. They weren't too spicy though and overall were good. The portions were a LOT larger than I expected. These are not your typical Mrs. T pierogis. These are twice the size and you get a ton of toppings. We each only ate about 3 of the 6 pierogis we had on our plates! (Yay leftovers!!)  Overall, I am looking forward to returning sometime soon to try the Reuben and Breakfast pierogis! Great service, great food, and easy to get to location!

3yUSK_fWz4uySQ8MT4NQdw.text: Underwhelming.  For starters, it's freezing in here. Every time the front door opens a blast of Arctic air enters.  Next, the pierogies were lukewarm.  They were mostly warm, but definitely not hot and combined with the freezing air they got cold almost immediately.  I ordered the chicken parmesan pierogies and they would have been pretty meh even if they were hot.  They were covered in a marinara sauce and shredded chicken and they just weren't great. They weren't bad, but...  The one bright spot was that the service was pretty good. The place was empty-ish when I got there and filled up quickly so seating was tight.  I won't be back. Too much great food in Pittsburgh for meh pierogies.

xWT-09BBLW_mizlZXCc8aA.text: Pierogies were excellent. They had good flavor and crisped just enough. There was a lot on the plate! The atmosphere was decent. Bar area and cute tables we sat at. Tvs weren't on. Service was decent and we were checked on but the server and the one guy working both had a little bit of an attitude. Not many smiles and didn't make us feel comfortable... the girl wasn't even there to get our check for us to receive her tip. There were only 3-4 tables in the joint so I don't know what she possible could have been doing besides fully attending her tables. Oh well! Food was still good.

XkjKV3cfJgaPScEcKEaGzw.text: I came to this cozy downtown establishment on a Friday night after a long evening work shift, and, well...it pains me to say it as a born and raised local pierogi lover, but I'm not in a rush to come back. This is due to a combination of staff and the food itself.  Let me be clear - I thought the food here was pretty good. When I was here I ordered one of their specials: a fried pierogi more or less stuffed with a thick lobster bisque. And this meal was good - unique and rich, but good! As good as it was, though, when I scanned the menu overall I thought things were a bit expensive for what was being offered. I'm not surprised - gotta pay that downtown rent somehow! But still, if I was just basing my review on the food, the pricing would move Stuff'd into a "special occasion" category for me.  The service, though...the service unfortunately nudged Stuff'd straight into the "no thanks" category. I was here on a pretty quiet Friday; there were empty tables everywhere. Despite this, not ONCE did a waitress or waiter come to my table. Instead, the poor bartender ran back and forth between his post and my table! He brought me a great drink, got my order to the kitchen, brought my order from the kitchen, and rang me out. I definitely tipped him well for doing double duty that night.  So yeah, it's a darn shame that a downtown Pittsburgh eatery didn't deliver on the amazing concept that is a pierogi bar. But while their prices and service have scared me off for the time being, at least this city isn't lacking in markets and eateries that also sell our favorite food!

The desserts are delicious, particularly the strawberry cheesecake Pierogi. The drinks are great with many variety. Everyone likes their drinks as well. You can also get creative with your drink. This a place definitely worth going back.

lF8QUJrpQbuth-eh-ZtfyA.text: We stopped in before a stage show. They explained that the kitchen was backed up & our sandwiches were taking a while. We could have canceled the order but instead paid for our meal & asked that it be cooked & packed for take out. We explainer would pick it up after the show. Sure they said. After the show we picked it up. It was supposed to be refrigerated- but wasn't. It was out on the counter. Once home, my husband opened his chicken sandwich to find that the top bun had a big chunk out of it. The bottom bun was broken in half.  None of this is acceptable. I'm sad because I wanted to go back to try their Pierogis. But not after service like this. Could have been a repeat customer.

t8V77ZR2jRDtK11ZvTv58Q.text: Just not very good. The Pierogies were boiled then pan fried but they were pan fried at a very high temperature so parts were harder and other parts were soggy. Im thinking they get business bc their open later. The servers seemed nice.

doDBPnR_cvafw5BRpfogHQ.text: I happened to be downtown for work attending a convention with an associate.  We wondered out to get a bite to eat when oh no, it becomes clear.  My associate has the palate of a picky child.  I made suggestion after suggestion to be shut down.  He wants Primanti's.  I said if you want that you can go alone.   After walking out of another place because he wouldn't eat anything on the menu, we ended up here, mostly based on defeat as there were so many other places I would have preferred but hey I like pierogis so let's give it a try.    Disappointing is really the only thing I can say about my meal and experience.  We walked into a nearly empty restaurant.  In other words I saw more employees than customers and that was the case throughout our hour and 20 minute lunch.  No we didn't take that long to eat, or got carried away in conversation.  We waited over 40 minutes for our lunches to be served.  More on that to come.  Once seated we are given menus, water is brought and then we are asked for drinks.  As I looked over the menu it hit me that this place was pretty pricey.  Several different "styles" of pierogis but even the most basic (potato and cheese) ones were $12.00 for 6.  You know it's just dough.  Some of the more elaborate styles like buffalo chicken or cheese burger were upwards $16-$18.  There was at least one kind that was over $20.  Call me crazy but that's a lot to spend on lunch, and on pierogis, but that's just my opinion.  They do offer half plates.  I opted for a Pittsburgh salad it came with chicken and two fried pierogis.  I asked for boiled instead of fried.  My picky lunch partner ordered a sandwich and half a serving of pierogis.    So  we waited, and waited, and waited.  At some point I started to look around the joint noticing no one was there.  No one. What's taking so long?  This is not an off hour we went over lunch a little after 12, so where are all the people and where is our food?    At around the 45 minute marker I see a man (not our server) and get his attention which even though this place was dead was not easy.  I think he was trying to avoid me.  I tell him it's been over 40 minutes he said he will check.  So about 5 minutes later our server emerges from the basement carrying our food.  She sets everything down and brings refills and leaves.  Well my pierogis were fried and not boiled as I requested but at this point I waited long enough.  She served them on the side and brought cups of sauteed onions (which were cloyingly sweet) and shredded cheese.  However, my lunch partners pierogis were dressed(sitting under a bed of onions, sour cream, and cheese).    The salad was standard salad.  Nothing special there.  Chicken was a little tough but they had a nice array of toppings.  It was also a little pricey at $14.00.  The pierogis which I was most looking forward to were just so, so hard.  I tried cutting them with a knife and the pressure of the knife just pushed the filling out of the sides.  If your forte is pierogis then these should be some darn good ones!  They were not prepared well at all.  I will say the potato filling was very creamy but both myself and my associate were underwhelmed with their specialty.    All considered, the mediocre food did not justify the elevated pricing. Throw in the extensive wait with no real justification I would not recommend this establishment or return.  I could only imagine how frustrating this would be for someone on a time limited lunch, you know like most people coming here throughout the week.

Dh-D9bpML7p15J8hEUzQBQ.text: Waited over an hour for our food to come out. Restaurant was full of tables waiting for food and wait staff was mostly MIA. Food was average and over priced. Good idea. Bad Restaurant.

5QcB5i0GBShte5r5gtg6VA.text: We came here before going to a show at the Benedum. Thank god we are four hours early because it took a very long time to get our food. We went one hour without being checked on once! The food was good but I'm not sure it was worth the wait. We got the buffalo Pierogi to share and it was very tasty but DRY! The waitress had a good attitude but the time just didn't cut it.

wmuUJyCWOlYioUry2DHFow.text: Heaven on earth!  Stupid delicious!  The pierogie variety and flavors are incredible.  The wait staff, bartender and overall service is amazing.  What are you waiting for!  Go there now!

r5f9rIP6kxB03KtTr7MU3Q.text: Terrible experience due to PISS POOR management.  I've worked in the food industry for 10 years now and I'm extremely understanding in this setting for that very reason. January 20th, 2018 we stopped in after World of Wheels after walking looking for a bite to eat, there was 3 of us, we didn't leave for about 2 and a half hours after walking in.  The manager told us it would be roughly 6 minutes to sit. We waited 10 and then grabbed a drink from the bar, it took us 50 minutes to be sat.  We were highly irritated but never complained.  Once we sat it took about 10 minutes to order, we all got the four course meal. The first round was salad or fries, fries were cold but we were starving so we didn't complain.  Second round was stuffed peppers, phenomenal. The third round was the main dish, pierogies of your choice.  Food was excellent, service wasn't very good but the server who had tables near by noticed and refilled drinks on the house.  Once we ate we were waiting for our server to order the fourth course dessert, she never came.  We went elsewhere for our check. When the server came by she took the check and we asked for our cheesecakes to go.  We never got them but she brought back the check.  We managed to get the managers attention to tell him about how we still hadn't received our dessert, he noticed we had paid and said "You guys weren't supposed to get a check, i'll be right back with your desserts." Roughly 5-10 minutes go by and we decided we'd had enough, we weren't waiting any longer so we got up to walk out where the manager was just standing near the bar.  When he seen us leaving he just started shaking his head. 90 dollar tab, we tipped 20.  Food was great apart from being cold, service was bad (apart from random server near by who was delightful) and the management was just awful. We loved the atmosphere and food selections but because of their treatment we will not return.

vGj_tvXi8J19rNrmUeq50w.text: Stopped here for a quick bite before a show at the Benedum.  We were seated and ordered food relatively quickly which was great.  Unfortunately it took forever to get our perogies and fries and when it finally made it to our table it was cold.  Honestly everything tasted great and I would even say it was fantastic except it was cold.  Because we were heading to a show I did not want to send the food back......

efHyBsjK_Xx3lDpe16iWhg.text: It's unfortunate that this wasn't good. Service it just awful they appeared unable to use their POS, tables sat with dirty plates for 30 minutes.  The food was not very good at all.  They are tiny and far overpriced. Save yourself and get some pierogi from the Thursday market in Market square.

eoGLXFVNAhFU79Hru4DOOg.text: I stumbled in here a couple weeks ago and ordered the chicken Marsala pierogies. I have been dying to come back and try other versions of their pierogies ever since. I have recommended this place to many people, I don't get the negative reviews. Don't trust them, trust me.

ADxbkI3piHfMRf87YzPXMg.text: The food is great, the portions are huge and the restaurant atmosphere is very nice. The only issue is slow service. If they correct this issue, this place will be are for a long time.

WruxZ5gebXs-pSMaNRuhjQ.text: Had to interrupt the bartender from a phone call to order.  Bartender proceeded to have a long phone conversation, clearly not business-related, the entire time we were at the bar and touched many of the things chopped and put into drinks for others without gloves. The staff were not particularly friendly and a child of one staff member sat in a booth unattended and played a game very loudly, which was disruptive. The menu was extensive, but the pierogies were a little over cooked. The atmosphere, decor, and location, however, were great. We will probably not be back.

OHMpB-v2lP_lIS71U-k74w.text: Excellent pierogi's and beer selection! The bartender was both friendly and knowledgeable of the area and beer (which was very cold on a hot day) which made a perfect visit. I would definitely visit this spot again!

EEhmGoO4CR6vJrnB_Uo0OA.text: I'll start by saying the food is actually decent, however this is the worst service I've ever had at a restaurant. We went for lunch on a weekday, and when we walked in around 11:45 there were only a few people seated. We ordered and waited about 25 minutes with no one coming to check on us. About 20 minutes after that, we went to ask a server for an update on our food and she said she would check on it. Our server never returned and finally, an hour after being seated, we decided to leave with no food. Nobody, over the course of the entire hour, came to check on us, apologize, or give us an update on our food. As we were leaving, our server ran up and offered to have our food boxed for us to go. We decided to do that, and as previously mentioned, the food was pretty good. The downside: we couldn't enjoy it together and had to eat it separately back at the office.

EtPPhOyI-XgB-5e5ffDHOw.text: The service was horrible. We were initially ready to excuse the staff for the poor service because it seemed like they were understaffed. However, we were given drinks we didn't order and when I questioned the waitress, she told me we were only charged for one not two and didn't apologize. We shouldn't have been charged for anything we didn't receive. To be honest, we should have been compensated for the terrible, incompetent service. When our dinner arrived, the order was wrong, we were missing salads, and were told that we were wrong in what we ordered. Overall, bad experience.   As a side note, it's really overpriced for what you receive. $16 for 6 pierogies is a bit much.

y3Rv-aQisWmY8Y_d_DYPWg.text: Great place. Very Pittsburgh. I came with a big group and got to try a bit of everything. I could not find something I didn't like. The waitress was very accommodating and friendly too.

m20MX52Ef3-TV8bNtohQTg.text: First, the food is delicious. It's clever, well made, pleasantly presented, and unique to Pittsburgh. The service is non-existent. I fell in love with the food the first time I went, but we had to scarf it down because we planned to have dinner before seeing a show. I gave them the benefit of the doubt bc it was fairly new and maybe they were working out glitches. However, I've been back twice since then and it still continues to be a problem. We arrived an hour and a half before show time, with a reservation. Luckily, no one was there (they've probably caught on to the fact you have to dine and dash to get to your show), but we were still scarfing our food down after waiting 65 minutes. During those 65 minutes we had one drink a piece, were never asked if we'd like another (which at $12 a drink The wait staff should be asking to refill often bc they're making bank on those). For the extent of their bar (probably have $15,000 in liquor behind the bar), the wine selection was pitiful. We had to ask several times where our food was - keep in mind it wasn't crowded. There were ample people working for the number of tables occupied, and we were there to spend money, yet no one paid us a bother (except Nick the bartender who is leaving after his next shift). It makes what is intended to be an enjoyable girls night out very stressful. I do not know how they stay in business with the service and wait times, their product is amazing and they are sitting on a gold mine and don't even realize it. Please someone help the pierogie bar to better function!! I can see the potential, but they need help!

sUDUTbqwkLtr18aoAwXjpg.text: Bring your chainsaw. These pierogis are tough and slow to arrive. We waited about 1 hour on a slow night. Breakfast pierogis were nothing to write home about and the bacon was REAL SOGGY. You might say--that's a novelty pierogi so you're rolling the dice.  But, we also went with the old standard--potato, onion, and cheese.  Guess what--crispy exterior and a sprinkling of sargento cheese product resting real chilly on top of that tasty treasure....Tourist trap! Not authentic! Skip it!!

urKiIA_ET91UoutfW7ac8A.text: I haven't read reviews on here yet, they have issues and kinks that need to be worked out as any new restaurant does but the food is incredible. I'm from a Polish family in Jersey, and the perogies taste exactly like my grandmother's. I'm very pleasantly surprised about this restaurant, they might be better than gooskis. Definitely worth checking out, they're a fantastic addition to the downtown Pittsburgh restaurant scene.

oJHd-F-Zczv7o8JoqvZj2g.text: Loved!  Excellent pierogies. My husband's family is Polish and thought these were great. Delicious, tender. Great service. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Christmas with family. Yum!

fuiLlJXMUkGIo0gYUekGZA.text: This is my second visit to this place this past Sunday before the Steeler game.  The first time this past summer I was disappointed but wanted to try it again.  It is amazing to me how poorly managed! Every employee seems to be armed with their  cell phone in their back pocket because that was their primary focus. The two tables by the front door sat with leftover food on it for 35 minutes before it was ever touched as people were in line waiting to get in the place.  I wanted to warn them to turn around it would be the worst waste of one hour of their lives.  This place has charm and decor but there can't be a manager that has any intelligence whatsoever running this place.  I want this place to succeed but how in the world could an owner hire people that have no clue how to manage a business?  It is beyond my belief that you could possibly run a business this poorly? The service is slow inefficient poor and again how can you leave tables with dirty food and dishes ? When we finally got our food we asked for the check and paid immediately because we knew would be 15 minutes before the waiter would return to our table and we didn't want to miss kick off.

uze8Z7MfT70zab-htkbVgA.text: Nice decor, and that ends the positive portion of this review.  But let's disregard the bad service, the long, long wait, the terrible value.  Their signature and most basic menu item, potato and cheese pierogies, were either Mrs. T's or an inferior version of Mrs. T's.  And the kitchen didn't even heat them properly.  They came ice-cold in the middle.  I sent them back.  20 minutes later, new ones came that were frozen in the middle.  I gave up.  With the bar so high for new restaurants downtown, with the costs so high for opening a new restaurant -- what are these guys thinking?!!!

dNamjChZD6Pr-2OSu5Q4Ww.text: We had low expectations given the reviews but were pleasantly surprised. The food was great!  Service was a bit slow but overall the person was very attentive and friendly. Awesome Pierogis!

SPbAxEqgikYU8HTMJw6Z9w.text: My first time in Pittsburgh and I knew I had to try pierogis! On a quick google map search, my friend found this place was super close to where we were (Andy Warhol Museum) and had great reviews. If you're at the AW Museum, this is a quick walk over the Andy Warhol Bridge (which also gives gorgeous views of the city)!   We came in at 3pm. It wasn't very busy at all and we were seated right away. My friends and I took awhile looking through the menu and didn't know what we had wanted when our waitress first asked. However, she didn't come back to ask us about our order for at least 20 minutes! I'm not sure what happened, but the people around us who came in after us with a different waitress got their order in and food out way before we did. By the time we got our food it was 3:45pm.   The pierogis were delicious however! It almost made up for the long time we spent just waiting. I got the mac & cheese pierogis, which were delicious! But they are extremely filling! You get 6 pierogis, which may not sound like a lot, but this place lives up to its name! They're stuffed and huge!!! My friend who got classic potato pierogis was the only one able to finish all her food. I would recommend one of the heavier pierogis if someone at home will eat the leftovers same day because I don't think most people could finish these and they might get soggy after awhile. None of this detracts from how delicious they were though! Also, they have a great selection of vegetarian pierogis.  I also couldn't help but notice how this painting at my table was hung.....why would you hang it like this....

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese pierogis
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu!
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great way to hang a painting

mDpVTrGyb3zOrLwpIyc2Gw.text: When I think of Pittsburgh, pierogis are one of the first things that come to mind. And these are some of the finest pierogis I have ever tasted. The fancy ones are nice, but the basic potato and cheese version is to die for! The caramelized onions are so sweet that you have to try them to believe them. Absolute perfection. The staff are phenomenal! The bartender went went through the menu and made sure I got exactly what I wanted. She was so kind to us and the food was so good, that I actually made a return trip on the last day of our work trip to have one more plate of potato magic and make sure that it was not a one off fluke. I'm glad I did, it was just as amazing on the second try.   All my friends in PGH told me to this was the spot to be, even though most hadn't tried it yet. I'm excited to report back to them that they need to stop in.   Thanks for making my trip back to one of my favorite cities a great foodie experience.

7XEP4casTv4mHxWFvgKtrA.text: DONT GO HERE!  Overall horrible experience I would never wish on anyone. Other than maybe those people that cut you off without using a turn signal.   Got there at 3:30 on a Sunday. Didn't get my food until 5:00. (There was not that many people there.) food was burnt and cold like it was sitting underneath the heat lamps for an eternity. The one set of rogies was just the traditional and the cheese wasn't anywhere close to being melted. I rarely voice my displeasure but I thought this was exceptionally bad. The manager came over and pretty much told us that's how they normally roll and we should've expected shabby service all around.   This is the only restaurant in Pittsburgh that I will go out of my way to tell people not to waist their time or money here.  I feel most of my reviews are positive, so if you still go here after reading this.  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.    0/5 Not worth it my guy.

FWqVZx8YlnbEH9Z627eyGA.text: We came in on a Sunday, after a Steelers game . The place seemed a bit unsettled, tables empty but not cleaned off. Our server was okay but somewhat distracted and hurried despite it not being really busy at the time. Our table got 4 different pierogie options and at the waiters recommendation deep fried. All of our dishes were dry and over cooked . I had great expectations for this place and was disappointed at the quality. I feel like pan fried might of been a better option, but they should not have been so ...overdone. We will likely give it another chance because we love the concept .

H00fqRx77qUOXLdRH0LEVA.text: As a Pittsburgher I LOVE pierogis. We came here in hopes of having delicious pierogis.  Sadly that was not our experience.  We had halushki, cheddar & onion pierogies $12, and Mediterranean $14.  I found those prices to be too much for what you receive- not sizewise- flavorwise. I am not one to shy away from paying more for good food. But I am not a fan when the food does not meet the price point.

u9uPIIEFXlZw1857G--t6Q.text: I have to say how terribly disappointed I was. Pierogis are one of my favorite Pittsburgh foods and when I saw this place I couldn't wait to stop in.   We walked in and were seated promptly at a booth in the back corner. (It's important to note the booths have very tall backs.) It took about 10 minutes for anyone to come over and check on us to get our server. By the time our server actually stopped by we were ready to order and she wasn't prepared to take it. After she went to grab her book, we finally got to place our order. We ordered the traditional potato and cheese, sweet cabbage, Mac and cheese, and sauerkraut on the side.   We waited about 25 minutes to get our food. The pierogis came out extra crispy (read: burnt and over cooked). The silverware was having a tough time cutting through the pierogi as they had gotten so tough from being over cooked (both overboiled and burnt on the grill). The Mac and Cheese pierogi were incredibly dry on the inside (seemed to lack cheese on the inside) and had an uncooked crumb topping. The sauerkraut, which they forgot to bring out to me and got about half way through eating, had been put on the grill and was riddled with burnt pieces. The grille needed to be cleaned. The onions were about the only item that was cooked well, nicely caramelized. The server never came back until we were ready for the check to see if we were okay or needed more to drink.   The restaurant itself was small but nice in appearance. Seating options included bar, high tops, or booths. Overall, the experience was less than expected and both service and quality of the food could use major improvement.

c8LOwq0jIDUTZpKcgNOWlw.text: I had their food at Picklesburgh today, so this might not be a completely fair review. I ordered the stuffed Rueben pickle, the Big Mac pierogies, and the jalapeno pickle pierogies. The Rueben pickle was interesting. I felt like it was missing sauerkraut and could use some warmed up meat and cheese. The Big Mac pierogies were tasty and I would recommend giving them a shot to anyone. The jalapeno pickle pierogies on the other hand were sort of gross... mostly because they weren't really cooked. They had very thick dough that was barely cooked, thus the stuffing was cold. I would probably give the actual restaurant a chance, but I would not go out of my way to make that happen.

dUt2B-17atBMUk0rVTBf_A.text: Decor/service: the decor was very nice. The service was good but it did take awhile for our food to arrive.  Food/drinks: they had a great beer and drink selection which made something everyone liked easy. The food was good but nothing spectacular. The deep fried piergoies we got were a little over cooked and could of used a little more of a sauce due to being dried out some. Other than that had no real complaints about the food.

DFpHba8FwQA3ZItFP4E1Fg.text: It was late and we hadn't eaten yet, so we went in search of a place that would allow for a late dinner.  We are that typical couple that just can't figure out where to go to eat.  We headed toward Downtown knowing that there would be plenty of places to choose from.  We stumbled upon this gem of a place.  We checked the menu in the window before we made sure this was where we wanted to go.  Everything looked wonderful the way they were described.  Just to clarify for me, pierogies are little pocket filled pillows of life.  Especially when there are made fresh.  When we walked in we were told to sit wherever we wanted and menus would be brought to us.  We opted for a booth toward the back, away from the noise at the bar.  Shortly after we sat down we had menus in hand.  We placed our drink orders and went over the menu.  My eye kept getting caught by two items on the menus, making it harder than it should have been.  I went between the traditional Potato and Cheese and the Mac and Cheese.  I just kept going back and forth over and over again.  Funny thing was that my better half kept going back and forth with the same ones.  We made a compromise, I would order the Mac and Cheese and he would order the Potato and Cheese and we would share them.  Order placed and we just waited.  Besides the obvious differences with the filling the only difference between the two is the sauce on the side.  Sour cream for the Potato and Cheese and Sriracha Sour Cream for the Mac and Cheese.    Both variety of pierogi were amazing.  The Potato and Cheese were not too heavy, filled with the right amount of filling.  Pan fried was the appropriate way to go about these ones.  Flavor trapped in the pasta part mixed well with the ingredients enveloped inside.  The Mac and Cheese ones were amply stuffed.  Not your typical pierogi but totally worth a try.  The mac and cheese was the right consistency.  More cheesy than I expected and allowing for a very flavor filled bite.  The only miss here is the Sriracha Sour Cream.  To me it did not mix well.    We could not finish these so we took them to go when we could not fit anymore in our stomachs.  They made for a great meal later.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Traditional and Mac n Cheese pierogies.

xAZpWZm-4pzvEnWOS5fphQ.text: Pierogis are delicious. That's a pretty accepted concept. This place goes for the "go big or go home" ideology. The pierogis are huge & you get 6 of them. I ordered the sauerkraut & potato ones to be a traditionalist & I was honestly underwhelmed. They didn't have much flavor & were in desperate need of salt. The side of sour cream is tiny. I came for an early dinner, restaurant might have had one other table filled & we barely saw our waiter. I can't say I'm eager to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sauerkraut &amp; Potato

JA9IU5bFPG45kUrzEJ5iGA.text: Avoid!  We will NOT be back. Looking for a quick drink before our event we walked into this pierogi bar. We ordered 2 beers on draft. Big mistake. The beer came out of the tap all foam. I got a light beer and I could taste it was off. Gross.  We watched as a party entered and waited too long to be seated in a mildly busy bar. The staff seemed thrown off just by having to serve people. We did not order food. After the disaster of the draft beers and disappointing service we were afraid to consume anything else.

LHHzFF7_k_FRRJIEORRSxg.text: This place has the rudest employees! Here now and no one said a word when we came in. Watched others come in...wait....and leave.  Marsala pierogies were cold and flavorless. Sat at the bar. Bartender started to be nice. Waitress was so rude. This is her. Very bad attitude.
