ZFDUlC9HgCbYqYIsxJdaBg.text: Walked in had to seat yourselves, on a non busy day.  Waited about 10 minutes just to get our water, then 5 more to get the drinks we ordered.  Place our order, and After about 40 minutes we decided to ask the waitress if our food was close to coming out .  She decided to walk back to the kitchen and came out and told us it is on its way out.  After 15 more minutes there was no food and a puzzled waitress saying that she thought it was on her way out.    At this point we reach the hunger limit for a day and a threshold for common sense , so we decided to walk away from the failed investment we call an experience at the pierogies shop .   I would like to give a review on the food but unfortunately we didn't make it that far in a restaurant experienced

3u7_sf2ps20LuKKZ0W6eAg.text: I really liked this place and wanted to give it a higher review.  The place is struggling is some ways and outperforms in many others.  First of all the pierogis are awesome!  The breakfast, traditional, sweet cabbage, Reuben, pizza, chicken parm..  I mean making Pierogi is their art and they take it seriously.  They are large and delish!  Our waitress Kat was spectacular, she really knew her stuff and made it a great evening.  The misses of the evening were small but obvious - their red sauce is very pasty and takes away from the delivery of the food and the the when you get your wine some times it comes served in a wine glass, bar glass, but never the same glass twice.  Pretty amateur.  But the pierogis were amazing.  Come for them!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast Pierogi

qFhoyuJ5J-Wfhl32zWfkAg.text: A friend asked to meet up for lunch. She thought that this place would be something fun to go to. While it's not as close to my work as I would have liked I thought it sounded pretty good so I made the trek there.  We sat at the bar when we got there. There are mostly high top tables and the bar seemed the best place to get served and to hang out.   The menu is pretty extensive. It was hard to just pick one kind. I ended up picking the pulled pork and the veggie. I also got a side basket of fries because ... fries are delish.  So, the pierogies took a bit to come out. And they were a bit chilly when I finally got them. While they weren't cold, cold, they weren't hot. That would be my only complaint.   The pulled pork tasted great. The sauce and the amount of meat was, yum. I was able to take half back to my co-workers and they loved them.   The veggies were so good that I ate them all in that sitting. Really good filling and the sauteed veggies were on point.  I want to come here again, I just hope the temperature is better!! The food was good. And I'm willing to trek out to try it again.

Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie

_0yDb6fl78IavB1SEvln6Q.text: Wanted something new before going to a show.    It's a small place in downtown (dahntahn) Pittsburgh so avoid a large party if you can.    Being acknowledged to get a table was a bit challenging, took 5 minutes for anyone to greet is even though you're literally 2 feet from the bar.  But we did get sat.   Waitress was nice and kept up with our orders, letting us know when things were behind and how food was coming along.   The food was EXCELLENT, peach bbq pierogi and Reuben pierogi's were awesome.  We got loaded fries as an appetizer and highly recommend.    Overall, food was great, but don't be in a hurry.  Gotta have it at least once, especially since pierogi's are a delicacy in this part of PA.

97IT85ZRxAd6L406QRlnxA.text: I have never written a review before as I know how hard it is to work in the food business however this place deserve a bad review! Sorry. They are located right next to the Benedum center so you'd imagine they are used to handling crowds and have a fast service well they don't!  I ordered two chicken tenders and fries for my children thinking it would be fast to make and so they could get something to eat before we headed to see the show.  We waited more than an hour and left without food because the waitress told us it would take another 15 mn.  Sorry to say, the place wasn't that busy and other customers were not getting food either.   My advice to the chef, go back to school or go work the line in a restaurant and see how it's done!!!

bC1xuMzmj9xUua4TXq6u0Q.text: I can't actually even get this place 1 star because I never got to try the food I ordered.  I brought my boss in to eat Pierogies since she was visiting from Chicago.  About an hour after we ordered food we still had not gotten it and our drinks were never refilled. We walked up to get more drinks and asked about the food. They said 10 more mins. 30 mins later and still no one came back over I went and asked the server about our food. He said he saw it on the grill. I asked for an ETA. He went to the kitchen and came back to tell us he cancelled our order 20 minutes ago. He said they were too busy tonight. We were 1 of 3 tables.  We asked to speak to the manager and he said she was too busy. We asked to find her and he said he couldn't. He took my information and we left after 2 hours of being there and never getting served. Will be calling the manager tomorrow

pw1nqlfxO4C7h7Xa8hNRIA.text: This was a terrible experience! They were understaffed and slammed. The waitress and bartender were doing the best they could, however an hour later when we finally got our food, it was luke warm and not great. The perogis were too thick and doughy. The manager ended up comping our food when they actually showed up. This restaurant is settup for failure.

8iC2Z_hkOBtyoojUuUwMsw.text: After seeing a show at the CLO Cabaret, we decided to walk around the corner to Stuff'd and see what it was all about. It was around 4pm on Sunday and when we walked in, there was nobody in the restaurant which made us a little nervous. By the time we ordered and ate, the place was completely packed. We each decided to order a different type of pierogie and then share with each other since there were so many good options. Every entree comes with 6 huge pierogies and the different toppings. We had lobster mac and cheese, peach bbq pulled pork and chicken marsala. The group favorite was hands down the peach bbq pulled pork - it was fantastic! All the pierogies were very good and our waiter was a super nice guy. I would definitely return if I am in the area.

jS4EaX4mBqpAdYlnxzcPtA.text: Arrived on a Tuesday night around 6:20--two parties in front of us.  Wind blowing in front door--wind curtain blowing cold air.  Party at a table next to the line at the host stand were bundled in their coats and I overheard on person at this table talking about being "hangry."  They had no drinks or food on their table.  Bartenders were dressed in hoodies and knit caps so you know it was cold in there.  Waited a few minutes and one party in front of us left.  We waited another 5-10 minutes.  Not one employee was seen other than the two bartenders who did not make eye contact with all the people waiting to be seated.  We decided to leave, and the people that were first in line said they had been waiting 15 minutes with no one coming to greet them.  They summed it up perfectly - "If they had just told us they couldn't accommodate us, it would have been fine.  But they didn't."  As I'm writing this on a desktop computer, I glance to my right and see another review where they experienced the same thing but a month earlier.  Who is in charge of this restaurant? Obviously this person has no pride in their work or their reputation.  This was our first -- and last -- visit.

15ef1uslx3Ve2O7pgOWnjQ.text: Guys guys guys.... I'm not a picky eater but this was really bad. I'm sorry, I'm not trying to be a jerk but I actually had to "eat the two finger sandwich" afterwards just to make myself feel better. The employees were super nice so it's nothing against them. If the food were better I'd definitely come back because they were so nice and entertaining. But the food was so greasy and both over and undercooked at the same time somehow. My first two beers were also weird tasting and flat. Please taste your food before you serve it!

zyTGDlHDuBUcfWk9onnQrQ.text: OH MAN!!!!! this place didn't disappoint.  We had one of EVERYTHING and was happy we did.  First off may I suggest getting a 1/2 order so that you are able to try more.  It didn't say they offered it on the menu but when I asked the server she told me that they were able to accommodate.  There was a split on the favorite....My husband was a HUGE fan of the Cheeseburger one...I however was in LOVE with the buffalo chicken ones.  If I had to find a least favorite I would say you could pass up the Mac n Cheese ones....and the dessert ones still need a little tweaking.....But man ol man I am glad we didn't live closer cause I would be here all the Time. I give an A+++ for the good eats and A+++++ for the staff.  Bartender was knowledge and personable so was our server!

JM_Umxhwf0co2wUrzCIAIg.text: If they would fire every single person that works here and hire people who actually know how to work in the service industry this place would be great. The food is amazing. The service, however is the worst I've ever experienced. I worked in the service industry for 8 years so I tend to hold places to a higher standard. However, even giving this place the benefit of doubt it is downright AWFUL. On multiple occasions I've experienced this. I stood at the door when the entire restaurant was empty for 15 minutes waiting for a table. The servers talk loudly about inappropriate things. My food has been cold on multiplier occasions. You cannot order over the phone because they NEVER answer it. It's a real shame because the food is good or has potential to be good. Maybe if it were under different ownership or something. I advise that you do not go here unless you have 2 hours to spend, at least.

F9xpNciUegIWoJUWMhAsQw.text: Still early in operation, the kitchen was backed up and slow, and had run out of a couple options on the menu, but other than that it was really great!  The menu was simple, two options for preparation, boiled or fried, with a list of about 15 variations of perogies.  It had a nice bar, but the seating was fairly limited, and quiet a few people turned away after hearing the wait time.  We will definitely come back, it was delicious!  We got the potatoes and sauerkraut and the hamburger perogies, and would recommend both!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato and sauerkraut perogies, hamburger perogies

-Gq5gsMiRbt907nvw8dOGg.text: Had dinner here for the first time last night. Made reservations prior to attending show at Benedum. Arrived early prior to meeting friends. The bartenders and servers were the friendliest group of people I've seen in a long time. Once seated, our server, Stephanie, made you feel like an instant friend! The pierogies are amazing! Able to order half orders. I ordered half Reuben pierogies, and half potatoe and cheese. OMG, they were so good. Huge portions! Will definitely be back!

706kF56B_-9mbV_uOTJVuw.text: About a year ago I stumbled upon Stuff'd pierogi bar, hoping to get some very delicious pierogis.  I thought that the pierogis were relatively good, but the service was HORRIBLE.  I told myself it was because they just has first opened an were trying to figure things out still.  Over a year later I went back and the service was still HORRIBLE. The place was nearly empty and we waited about 7 minutes for someone to even acknowledge we were standing at the front waiting to be seated.  We ordered immediately when we sat down because we were scared that the waitress would take another 30 minutes to come back.  The food was once again fine, but not worth the horrible service.  And to top off the mediocre experience we forgot our leftovers there! :(

RHEV1ukkdt1Fpk91vE_-Xg.text: Never go to this restaurant. Food is average. Service is abysmal and the atmosphere is generally unsafe. We were seated by a man who was obviously intoxicated who subsequently was throw out of the restaurant by another employee who then told us he didn't work there??? This person continued to attempt to come back into the restaurant during our meal and then was outside after we left and actually became involved in an altercation with one of our group. As well, our waitress left the building with my debit card to have a cigarette. Worst dining experience we've ever had in Pittsburgh.

w5T4DXxl0rx9_kjVgzktGg.text: Love the atmosphere and food could probably deserve a 4 star but the service more like a 1 or 2. Undecided if we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Marsala pierogi (chicken kinda dry) and Pulled Pork pierogi (I love pulled pork but felt it may be a little over kill w/ the meat)

xSkK3-geC9tPC3OTaOT1HQ.text: My coworkers and I came here for lunch a few days ago.  It was around 1, so after the lunch rush and pretty empty.  My experience was not fantastic, but not awful, just middle of the road.  I got the buffalo chicken salad with buffalo chicken pierogies.  It was huge!  Honestly, the buffalo chicken on the salad was better than the pierogies.  It didn't seem like there was any buffalo chicken sauce in the pierogies.  Anyway, we weren't offered anything other than water and it took a really long time for us to get our food.  We were there for about an hour and a half.  If you are a restaurant downtown, you should realize that people are on their lunch breaks and need to be in and out.  Also, remember, the reataurant was pretty empty.  I might go back with my husband as more of a novelty experience, but wouldn't make it a destination.

e4jyN7uhgInw_f-xji5rsA.text: 45 min.  Still no food.  Has to revise order 3 x.   Thought the product availability and service issues wpuld have been sorted by now.

qxabQDfc8z2p0dqIDD04sA.text: This place was amazing. The service was great. We got the breakfast Pierogis, pulled pork pierogis, classic pierogi, and the banana peppers. They were all delicious, pulled pork being our fav. Highly recommend

wlwA693w1yIAdvI57YbQqA.text: The food is great the service is the worst I've ever experienced. If they could fire the entire staff and rehire it would be amazing.

YPYN8Py7bLoC8SiD6n3b-Q.text: Pierogis here are some of the best you will ever have.  Definitely recommend stopping into this establishment while visiting Pittsburgh.

wto9SQxsgrFLpopNEBW7sw.text: We had the potato & cheese, sweet cabbage and the spring roll pierogies. Our top favorites were the sweet cabbage and potato & cheese. The spring roll was a close second. Nice ambiance! We'll definitely be back!

h4NS5OjDrqhQA6JWMT9a6Q.text: They were out of almost all the pierogis on the menu, the refrigerator was broken and they couldn't serve meat, the booth was too tight to accommodate more than 4 people, and the kitchen was backed up for 25 minutes.  Very poor service.

bq7SJLJKI9SY6JxRtzPgQg.text: Went there for lunch with co-workers and had an awful experience.  We got there at 11:30 because we had a group of 6 and I didn't see anywhere that they could take reservations.   There was a single bartender serving the entire restaurant...seating people, taking orders, serving and bussing tables.   Speaking to him when I paid the bill, he was also responsible for putting sauces on dishes, and  bringing them up from the downstairs kitchen   Needless to say, this poor guy was overwhelmed, resulting in horrible service.   The food itself was decent, but not great.  The consensus was that it likely was under heat lamps too long or perhaps the kitchen was equally understaffed. In total, our meal took 2 hours from start to finish....hardly a good idea for lunch.  In conclusion...a good concept, a good menu, but terrible execution due to understaffing.

ZEbxgErjXNPA0LitvXr52w.text: Do not go to this restaurant with a group of people, they cannot handle it.  We had a group of 7.  First they put us in a lounge next door because there were no tables available.  The beers in the adjacent bar were much more expensive.  After an hour wait, our food finally arrived.  Out of seven orders they screwed up one order and forgot another.  Total chaos.  If they would have told us up front how long the wait would be, that would have been fine, but they strung us along with no explanation.

wfjwu2pJxK-IE8APVpqjzw.text: Unfortunately this isn't a review of the food...because it never came! My coworkers and I were super excited to try this new place for lunch. Who doesn't like the idea of pierogies stuffed in all things bad for you...and then pan- or deep-fried, right? From the moment we entered and the bartender/manager/aka PT-chef-when-hell-breaks-out-in-the-kitchen yelled at the servers for placing a party of 3 at a table for 6, and our group of 6 at two high-top rounds (which never works well). Nonetheless, we settled in, ordered our food, and 50 (yes, FIFTY) minutes later - NOTHING had come out of the kitchen but excuses and apologies (with no food in sight). No joke. We had to call it a day, left Stuff'd hungry, stopped at Sienna Mercato and 30 minutes later ordered, ate, AND paid. Ba da boom! Sorry, Stuff'd, but we won't be back soon...or ever probably.

4tJWi3ZjIzaSdkdiMfe7iw.text: I have to say, I went here with friends and after reading the reviews on Yelp, we were all a little skeptical. We went on a Friday night and it was busy but not packed. All four of us ordered a different pierogi entree so we could share. We weren't at all disappointed by any of the options and were pleasantly surprised given the reviews.  I can agree the service here may not be the best, but I wouldn't complain about it either. Average. And they do run out of things, which can be a disappointment, especially when they are out of seasonal items and don't update the menu. That's my biggest reason for 4 stars--update the menu when you're done serving a certain cocktail or menu item.   Overall, I would go back but this won't be at the top of my list.

gfiYTquP6oQ7tQ9bs0wRbg.text: Literally, the women at the bar are some of the nicest, hard-working people in town.   Food? Delicious. Atmosphere? Festive. There's a reason it's packed. It's one of the best places in Pittsburgh.

tnlwMowvqqMSNh7rYnA2Yw.text: Absolutely amazing pierogis. We got a full order of the lobster mac and cheese, and half orders of chicken parm, chicken marsala and the potato and cheese. Oddly enough, i think the potato and cheese were my favorite!! They are huge and definitely worth the price.

5-11Sr8EHOdGMMNrzyoIhw.text: Service was a little slow, and it's a tad pricey, but the food was great and the portions large. I'd probably come back

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese Pierogies. Really good

DmT3pyzIX_hUlZqosmiHbA.text: Wow this place is foul. For starters we walked in and we couldn't get a seat. This place didn't have a hostess. So after waiting a few minutes the only server working there and came to seat us. She sat us in this booth in the very back corner and where there was no lights and it smelled like mold so bad. So when our server, Sheena, finally came over to get our order, we moved to a better booth, then we all ordered our kinds of perogies and we requested them to be boiled. It took the food 1 hour to come out. It was so long we had to go back and pay on our parking meter so we wouldn't get a ticket. When our food finally came out, our perogies were crispy and seemed fried and harder than a rock. When we asked sheena why our perogies were this way when we requested them to be boiled, she yelled at us saying they were boiled and they were pan seared too. The service was lousy, our server was rude and yelled at us, and the perogies sucked. We will never, ever be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4b4fiY9wA5FqsQ0stnAKIg.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I could. I'm still sitting at the bar as I write this too. My friend and I were super excited to try this place out, sorry to say now we wish we hadn't.   The service was friendly at first and is now an absolute train wreck. The bartender, Nate, forgot our order to 10 mins after we placed it and STILL got it wrong when the order came out 1 hour later. Numerous tables had their order before us. I was given a beer I didn't order, I only ordered water. When we brought it to the manager on duties attention she was less than thrilled we bothered her. The customer service is a straight 0.   We both work in the food service industry and completely understand everyone had those days or shifts but customer service has never been something We wouldn't let slip to the side.   The half assed sorry was horrible. Seemed like it was our fault? Worst service we've ever had.. everrrrr!!! We will NEVER come here again.

cWc9wwA-e3Zz2qMWG02u_A.text: My husband and I stopped in last weekend. The service was outrageously horrible. The bartenders wore skin tight leggings without undergarments, they were rude, one of them wiped her nose with her hand on a continuous basis, they took my glass and got ice from the bin using the glass they served me in... They immediately told us upon sitting down that there would be no food because the ticket machine didn't work. Not sure if they ever heard of a pen and pencil. I was only in the place 1 minute and knew I would not be eating there anyway so that point was moot! It took 15 minutes of being ignored before finally our drink was given to us. A bottle of beer and a glass of wine and a glass of water was not that complex. They bitched about the crowd, they bitched about each other, and they bitched about how hard it was to work there ....out loud. It was most uncomfortable cocktail of my life. And might I add again the entire time I got to watch women wearing light colored leggings with no undergarments! Classless place

9XgjemZPtHe5v3O-ZafpNA.text: Food was excellent and our waitress did a good job with everything she had to deal with. Food was slow but that was ok.  The biggest problem was the bartender making an ass out of herself and showing how much she hates her job.  Unlike any other person I've ever seen in the service industry she was terrible at her job and ruined a good experience for a lot of the customers that were in the restaurant at the same time we were. I would go back for the food but I would hope that they were able to get a better work environment for the workers who do seem to like their jobs.

cK0SmJJbZSt4s4MMYlvM4A.text: So wanted to try this place before a show. Went in early enough only to find only one person at the register and no waitstaff! Offered to sit at the bar to make things easier for the bartender and hurried to make a decision on what to order only to be told it wouldn't come out in time. Thank you for the honesty of the bartender but so disappointed! Would someone please enter a review when the staffing problem is corrected as I would really like  to go back and try the food.

s6PrVjXE6lw-Vbw_txLSlQ.text: These reviews are killing me! I'm Polish.  If I wanted pierogi exactly like my mom makes, I'd go to my mom's house.  If I want to go out for a drink and some delicious comfort food - I'll come here.   Full bar, long beer list, creative drink menu - and big fat delicious pierogi.  If we're speaking hipster -- it's Polish fusion.  And the haluski, yummmmm. Best ever.    The service was friendly and great.

rrPz5JZT_WR1iZQcCTfM3Q.text: This place was such a terrible disappointment. After months of wanting to try it out, we finally made our way over there only to be shown mediocre service with terrible food.  Upon entering, the place was kind of busy (take that with a grain of salt because the place is not that big), and the hostess didn't even acknowledge us for 5 minutes while we stood there. After getting seated, we had plenty of time to look at the place because our server didn't show up for a long while either. We were seated underneath an air vent that looked like it hadn't been cleaned since before they opened-dust was just CAKED on. The sinks in the bathrooms looked nice, but the soap dispensers were torn off the wall and just sitting on the counters. The whole restaurant looks like they tried to go with a vintage industrial kind of thing, but it looks like slopped together garbage, just like the food.  We ordered the buffalo chicken and the pulled pork Pierogi both boiled and then sauteed. They came out looking pretty sad, drowned in their "drizzle" of sauce. Any kind of sear they had from the saute was quickly diminished under the slosh of way too much sauce on both of the dishes. The buffalo chicken was awful. Not sure what kind of hot sauce they use, but it tasted cheap and vinegary, just like Franks, which is pretty sad because that is literally all you could taste even after trying to scrape them clean. The same could be said for the bbq, and the coleslaw they serve on the side is just plain nasty.  The only redeeming thing is the portion size. Those Pierogi are huge and served 6 to an order. If you could find an option that they didn't slather in sauce, the price of this place might be worth it. For us, we won't be back.

Tna9qE5Csl9UnIpxvbEKWw.text: Erin was an amazing waitress. Went by her recommendation and was so please food and atmosphere awesome!!!!

CftunD_PLRyA4ShIW9pEVg.text: Don't go here on an empty stomach. After waiting two hours for our food in a nearly empty restaurant, my companion got so hungry that she said that she felt like she was going to start burping up blood.  Our waitress skillfully avoided us for the entirety of the two hours, and never mentioned anything about why the food was taking so long.   We tried both the Mac and Cheese pierogis and the classic Potato/Cheddar, and opted for them fried. They reached our table dry, cold, and covered with massive amounts of slimy caramelized onions. Additionally, there are no vegan options here.  Avoid at all costs.

4koMd_dhu7otP2AI-e2Zbw.text: Waited an hour while waiter said food would be right out, then it took another 16 minutes. Was also blasting air conditioning. In the end my friend and I left because we had been waiting for an hour 16 minutes

tpphG_7crdBQL-K3_6E8Lg.text: The food here was fantastic - great traditional Pierogis but also really fun variations like chicken parm and spring roll Pierogis. Giving four out of five stars because our server forgot our drinks twice, messed them up when she finally brought them, and took forever to take our orders, follow up, and get our check. I hate leaving reviews based on service but this was pretty rough - as long as you're not too much in a rush though, you should be okay.

J263A1usqNWexMwPYJ4M0Q.text: This review is for their booth at Pierogi Fest. Total fail. They were not prepared for the crowd and offered too many options. People waited over an hour and a half to get their order. When we got ours the pierogies were tough. What is worse, is you wouldn't give people their $ back when asked. We're not going to try your restaurant that's for sure.

k4-kpI1NuISlC4McXjZKRg.text: My girlfriend and I came before a baseball game. It was pretty empty and the food still took forever. We got two different meal pierogis and one dessert one. The meal ones were cooked wrong, we received fried and not boiled/pan cooked. The waitress did not offer to change it when we pointed it out. The meal was pretty meh. The dessert was good though. I would not spend money here again or recommend it to anyone.

N6R1CiMOkAUaaulU2UEQdA.text: It sounds like our visit wasn't much different from the others I've read. It took several minutes to be seated despite several servers walking w/in feet of us serving other patrons. Not even a "one moment" or gaze in our direction while we stood there and waited. We each ordered separate pierogi dinners. My husband's fries were clearly old and stale. He nicely asked for fresh fries and the waitress responded with a passive-aggressive comment and an audible sigh. There were a few audible sighs from the waitress throughout our visit btw. Never had service quite like that before. Then the pierogis...meh. Tough and chewy. Toppings were better. Very disappointed. Do yourself a favor and heed the reviews. Wish we would have.

EfM4yEoDFgNiM3zt9xbXWw.text: You want real Pittsburgh? I mean "what do the common folks do?" They eat Pirogies! And this place is all Pittsburgh! Good food, great staff and some nice beer selections. You don't get more Pittsburgh than pierogi and beer!  This was awesome!

dsMf5aDTQJMeTORHdnirAw.text: Awesome spot we almost walked by! Tons of different types of perogies to choose from.... From traditional to taco! Salads topped with fried perogies. Even dessert perogies! Peanut butter beer!!! If ever I get back to Pittsburgh this will surely be on my list of places to return to.

7hK_JDNg9JLqNfJamZ3E_Q.text: This place tries really hard...which is why I'm giving it 3 stars.    It looks cool inside, it has a cool concept (pierogi bar), and it's conveniently located in the theatre district...but, part of me couldn't help but just say, "meh" on this place...no matter how bad I wanted it to be better.   The offerings are unique and fun and worthy of stepping outside one's comfort zone to try a non-traditional pierogi...but there's just something underwhelming about it all.  The service seems ok...the draft list is adequate...and the food is decent, but sadly, I wouldn't recommend this as a regular stop.   This is more of a "once in a blue moon" type of place that simply works because if its location.  Meh.

bup9Y1BIRZiwnJhqIAcq_A.text: Walked in this aft around 4pm. Noticed patrons were all wearing coats...it was like walking into a meat locker. So we left.

wkpHSEMt65LlwalDiiaEMQ.text: Most of the staff had unprofessional attitudes.  Five minutes spent staring at the "Please wait to be seated" sign before they told us to sit anywhere we liked. 10 minutes to get our drink orders taken. No heat. The pierogies weren't really "stuff'd" with much, and I don't think it was worth the price paid.

XQhUdz28_zYsjOpWD4lCCA.text: We came last night after the game. We expected it to be a long wait however we were one of maybe three tables there. We ordered our food and some simple bottles of beers. The place eventually filled up and those tables were served and left before we could get a second beer, let alone our food. We ended up waiting over an hour to get our food. The waitress continuously blamed the kitchen without giving a specific reason for the wait. I blame the fact that she disappeared for quite some time. She did us a solid by giving 10% off our bill...insert sarcasm. The only reason I gave this place a second star was because the Pierogies were amazing.

ZKQUNBoAYbxR0CVKvbZpTw.text: I had dinner here tonight, the quality of food was incredible (lobster pierogies--yum!). More than that, the bartender and servers were friendly, attentive, and very professional. It was a great experience, highly recommended.

wTWPaqIS5aG4nYauS5NHlA.text: Food was decent. Not bad but nothing to write home about. The prices are outrageous. $16 for 6 perogies.. I also don't like that there is literally nothing else you can get to accompany them besides french fries. The option to add kielbasa or some type of protein on the side would have been nice. The ambience is blah overall and the staff doesn't seem too into being there either.. Might have gave 3 stars until I realized I was drinking an expired beer. Ugh. Nothing great about this place to draw me back..

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hWaqe5416yRTagWmP8Oqsg.text: This place is very underrated (three yelp stars at time of writing). I showed up 3 weeks after their soft opening and granted they are having supply chain problems, but the Pierogi here are, as the kids would say, Dank af. Some of the best pierogi I have ever had. I would highly recommend this place. If they had been fully stocked and the menu was all hits with no misses I would definitely give five stars.   Deeper opinions: Call me old fashioned but boiled pierogi are far better than the deepfried. The boiled get pan fried after the fact (the waitress was very knowledgeable about their processes) and they end up being vastly supperior. So don't be afraid to trust in the Polish wisdom. I got sweet cabbage boiled and they were probably the best pierogie I have ever had. So if you try to go decadent with deep-fried cheeseburger and you are underwhelmed I have no sympathy for you. Since I was part of a big party, I also tried the greek, the standard, and the mac and cheese. Across the board solid but every time better boiled than fried.  They also have a fine selection of sauces.   Finally, Pie-rogie dessert? If you're like me, you're powerless to food pun portmanteaus. Fantastic, basically little pies but I dare you to be sad when eating a little pie.   I hope this place gets the chance it deserves to work out the kinks because they know how to cook em, and when it comes down to it, If that ain't the most important part of a restaurant, I don't know what is.

1RB9sFXxznbuEfmSKnlmrQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place since it opened and finally got the chance.  The restaurant was pretty empty, I am assuming it was because there were no shows tonight.  For dinner I ended up picking the buffalo chicken pierogies, but this dish wasn't my first choice.  There was a great variety of pierogies, but when the waitress came over the first thing she did was to go through a list of what they were out of, which was a few beers, a few mixed drinks, and 4 of their pierogie types.  Of course the 3 pierogies I was already debating between were all on the list of what they were out of.  Honestly I was thinking 6 pierogies wasn't going to be enough, but they were filling.  I was able to squeeze some room for dessert.  The cherry cheesecake pierogies were delicious and my favorite part of the meal.  Overall the pace of the meal was very slow too for there only being 2 tables seated.  This is a great concept restaurant for Pittsburgh, but just didn't hit the mark for me.  I can see bringing out of town guests here though.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cherry cheesecake pierogies
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken pierogies

lXYuK-7rPq9DF5Y3gdJwAw.text: Nice little place near the Andy Warhol Bridge. We shared an order of the Peach BBQ Pulled Pork pierogis, which were delicious and big enough for two. Our waiter was polite and attentive.

vUHbV8prpfpGNC7QHp2sRw.text: More like a 3.5 but I cant justify a 4. I went in kinda without any expectations. First off, its basically the same interior as the previous Grille on Seventh, but with a few new things on the wall. We went in for lunch and there was no one else in the place. I think we say 4 patrons the whole time.   I ordered the Reuben and my coworker for the buffalo chicken in salad form (you get 3 pierogies on the salad and 6 as the entree) We also ordered a side of fries. Initially I was like mm this is pretty good. My coworker tried it and he was like yeah its good but it tastes EXACTLY like a Reuben. I know usually I'd be like oh awesome I like Reubens and it tastes the same, but in reality, it didn't taste anything like a pierogi. They even gave me the marble rye bread. All I tasted was a reuben with a little bit of crunch because I got the pierogies fried. Maybe there needed to be some potato in the pierogies along with the corned beef. Because why would I pay $16 for pierogies that taste exactly like a reuben when I can get a real reuben for less than that. It was the same with my coworkers. It really just tasted like buffalo chicken dip on a salad. It was good, just missing the pierogi mark.   It wasn't a bad experience, I just feel like if its going to be a pierogi bar, I want my entree to taste like pierogies as well as whatever they are  trying to use as a flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fries
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben pierogi
Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken pierogi salad

PpdW9s4hyFemrGhaTLXIGQ.text: Stopped by for a snack and a beer.  Fantastic staff and 14 pierogi options, plus desserts.  Our waitress let my wife and I solid an order, sow we both had 3 pierogis of our choice.    My Peach Pulled Pork pierogi was FANTASTIC.  The beer prices and selection are good, and the staff was GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of Stuff'd Pierogi Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TV2IYbJ0WEnoYtfoqi0vaw.text: I went in with high hopes that were quickly dashed. We were seated promptly which may be the only thing I can say went well. We were asked what we would like to drink, but given no menu so stuck with water. We ordered pierogies and here began the problem. Though the place was not busy, an hour passed without our food, or anyone's food for that matter.  In the time we sat there only one table received their meal. When asked on the wait time, we were told the food would be out soon. Another half hour goes by. At this point we are ravenous and ready to walk to McDonalds when the food finally arrived. Was it worth the wait? No, one order of pierogies was burnt, one was luke warm, and the other hardly cooked. The waitress brought us a manager who immediately became defensive when presented with our concerns. She even went so far as to tell us the blackened food just had "a little more color" than most. After all of this she discounted our food only 15%. We arriving at 3:50 pm we never left until 5:50.

Ynt_Vh3lNfhIZ3j2b7nUbg.text: It's great to have a new spot where pierogi is the star. I was there during the "soft opening" and a limited menu.  The menu is full of your pierogi dreams and so very good. Many type of combinations they have and if they don't have it tell the attentive and friendly staff for an upcoming feature. They offer deep fried or boiled and pan fried (traditional style) and have add-on items like chicken. If you like pierogi you must try this place. I had the habanero watermelon chicken and the BBQ pulled  pork and they were both very delicious. I will be back to try them all. Plus a full bar and good beer selection.

0R5L6vNHD6GDbqtwayzz1w.text: I wanted to love this place. I make pierogis and I know it's a long process from start to finish. But our ticket time was 47 minutes on three plates of Pierogi for our family to share. No wait at the door. No warning of this when we sat down. Weary and hungry this was our first destination for Pittsburg food, our first time in the city. We were planning on getting a bite here and at several other Pittsburgh establishments, but the food took so long that we weren't able to do that. When we asked a manager to come over that was another 20 minute wait. We intended to ask how quickly we might order more but Manager Heather arrived with a rude attitude, biting sarcasm, and a quick promise to take 20% off our bill then ran away without even asking us how our meal was. (Answer- chicken parm was delicious, Mac n cheese came out cold, peach bbq was just ok). She changed her mind and took $3 off a $65 check then hid in the back of the house till we left. This place would do well to get rid of Heather and tell diners food will come out as it's ready. Had we known we would have ordered more or made this our final destination.

Tl1bWmdbESCDpUyG8IdK4A.text: I can't even give this place any stars. Horrible service. We never even got to order. We ended up just leaving as well as others did.

tgGbHODdL7iu1dzKzJx4WQ.text: Arrived at 7:20pm and didn't get our food til 8:20.pm..we waited for a table, which was fine. We decided to sit at the bar to wait for a booth because we wanted to be comfortable. While sitting at the bar, two waitresses started yelling at each other about something. They did not hide their disagreement whatsoever. When we sat down at our booth we were given our drinks and the waitress took our order. It took about 45 minutes for our food to come out. No one checked in with us from the time our drinks were delivered to when our food finally came out. The food was DELICIOUS but they wouldn't know because no one asked how we were doing. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE.

5Fp3e2G3Ylpb10f5PwkIyQ.text: Looking for somewhere to have a drink & grab a bite on a Saturday evening, we were excited to find a Pierogi oriented bar/restaurant. They have a full bar and a small selection of draft beers. We walked right in and sat at the bar. The place did not appear busy with many bar seats & tables empty. It took a while for the bartender to even say hello let alone ask what we would like. After we finally were able to order food our glasses sat empty for another while. It was just plain ole terrible service combined with a total lack of personality from those behind the bar. When the food finally made it out our drinks were refilled for the final time. My food, although flavorful, was only warm at best. I ordered "pan fried" Pierogis and they appeared to have just thrown into a pan without any type of oil/butter and arrived with a dry exterior - not how I would expect a Pierogi to be fried. We only managed to get two drinks refilled in the more than 90 minutes we were sitting at the bar. Overall terrible & unapologetic service and a lack of engagement from the bar staff. Even though the food was OK, this experience will definitely keep me from returning. Not sure I would recommend this one, there are too many better options downtown Pittsburgh.

lTUDOhOAKs9dDXn0CN6ltg.text: I was in town, from Philadelphia, in January of 2019. Being from a Polish neighborhood in Philadelphia, I wanted to get some great Polish food. January 30, was a freezing cold night in January and I walked over the the Stuff'd Pierogi. Once inside, I noticed people in their coats and I saw my breath - the heat was broken! I thought about turning around, but the engaging staff and the smell of the food kept me inside. I even gave the bartender a pair of hand warmers. I ordered a couple of my traditional favorites: sauerkraut and potato and cheese. If these were messed up, there would be no reason to try anything else.  The food came out quickly and, in spite of the bar's internal temperature, was hot! There was plenty to eat...pierogies were a good size, cooked in butter and onions and topped with sauerkraut. My initial bite caught the flavor of the onions, butter, sauerkraut and the delicate dough. Each had the same amount of filling - seasoned perfectly. The pierogies were amazing! I have to give the staff credit for toughing it out when they could have easily closed.   I've got a trip to Pittsburgh coming up in a few weeks and can't wait to get back to try a few of their specialty pierogies.  This place is certainly worth the trip.

-rJuQQL-GiYwsVu8CW7S6w.text: This was is awesome.  Our table had the Reuben, mac n cheese and lobster, and the Mac and cheese. All of this was ridiculously delicious. Big portions. Staff was friendly and just the right amount of attentive. I'm from out of town but you bet this is where I will come back when I'm Pittsburgh. I highly recommend it. Ignore the bad comments.

2BPVQyepHISFxwaPKKPnDQ.text: I really wanted to like this place more than I did, considering it's a pierogi place in the Burgh. I visited for dinner with a friend prior to seeing a show at the Benedum. Upon entering, it was slow and there were not many patrons. It was about 530, so it was hit or miss on how busy it would be. The server/hostess met me at the door and seated me in the back. It's not a terribly large place but has a nice sized bar.  I waited about 15 mins for my friend to arrive, and it was not until right before she arrived did they ask if i would like anything while I wait. It didn't take long for us to order food and have it placed, however it did take over 45 mins for the food to come out. The restaurant did become busier as time went on and filled up pretty quickly. Our orders were placed long before it got crowded, and it still took a considerably long time for the food to come out. A few other tables that arrived after us got their food prior to ours. When it did finally come, I was missing the pierogis on top of my salad, which they fixed quickly and without question. The food was good, but I wasn't overly impressed. I ordered a side salad with a plan pierogi and a half order of the Spring Roll pierogis (yes, you can order a half order of three rather than the usual six). They were tasty and filling, but the staff were very poor. They did not check back in with us, there was only one waiter for the whole place with another woman assisting him, and several other tables were agitated about waiting over an hour for food. While the staff was not rude, they just appeared busy and not able to attend to people as the should.  If you don't mind waiting and want to try some fun types of pierogis, it might be worth checking out.

SPgxNCnZasNoe2RYRSMgJA.text: The pierogies were excellent.  However, we waited 90 minutes for our food (and they had about 50% of the tables empty so it was not busy) and when it was finally delivered, one of our friends ordered Haluski (as her meal) and she was told that they "ran out of haluski" as they delivered everyone else's meals. She had no dinner at this point because ordering something else would have taken another 90 minutes!! The female bartender was blatantly rude, rolled her eyes and was obviously bothered that we asked her for our check (we had to ask her because our waiter never returned after bringing our food, 45 minutes later!) When one of the couples paid her and they waited for their change, she asked what they were waiting on and when they responded with "our change", her response was "are you serious?"  She assumed their change was automatically going to be her tip! I have never, ever written a negative review for any restaurant but this was such poor service, I couldn't let it go.. Maybe try takeout because the food itself was very good!
